register.name: ATS12NSOPR
register.gui_name: Address Translate Stages 1 and 2 Non-secure Only PL1 Read
register.description: Performs stage 1 and 2 address translations as defined for PL1 and the Non-secure state, with permissions as if reading from the given virtual address.

register.name: ATS12NSOPW
register.gui_name: Address Translate Stages 1 and 2 Non-secure Only PL1 Write
register.description: Performs stage 1 and 2 address translations as defined for PL1 and the Non-secure state, with permissions as if writing to the given virtual address.

register.name: ATS12NSOUR
register.gui_name: Address Translate Stages 1 and 2 Non-secure Only Unprivileged Read
register.description: Performs stage 1 and 2 address translations as defined for PL0 and the Non-secure state, with permissions as if reading from the given virtual address.

register.name: ATS12NSOUW
register.gui_name: Address Translate Stages 1 and 2 Non-secure Only Unprivileged Write
register.description: Performs stage 1 and 2 address translations as defined for PL0 and the Non-secure state, with permissions as if writing to the given virtual address.

register.name: ATS1CPR
register.gui_name: Address Translate Stage 1 Current state PL1 Read
register.description: Performs stage 1 address translation as defined for PL1 and the current Security state, with permissions as if reading from the given virtual address.

register.name: ATS1CPW
register.gui_name: Address Translate Stage 1 Current state PL1 Write
register.description: Performs stage 1 address translation as defined for PL1 and the current Security state, with permissions as if writing to the given virtual address.

register.name: ATS1CUR
register.gui_name: Address Translate Stage 1 Current state Unprivileged Read
register.description: Performs stage 1 address translation as defined for PL0 and the current Security state, with permissions as if reading from the given virtual address.

register.name: ATS1CUW
register.gui_name: Address Translate Stage 1 Current state Unprivileged Write
register.description: Performs stage 1 address translation as defined for PL0 and the current Security state, with permissions as if writing to the given virtual address.

register.name: ATS1HR
register.gui_name: Address Translate Stage 1 Hyp mode Read
register.description: Performs stage 1 address translation as defined for PL2 and the Non-secure state, with permissions as if reading from the given virtual address.

register.name: ATS1HW
register.gui_name: Address Translate Stage 1 Hyp mode Write
register.description: Performs stage 1 address translation as defined for PL2 and the Non-secure state, with permissions as if writing to the given virtual address.

register.name: PAR
register.description: Returns the output address (OA) from an Address translation instruction that executed successfully, or fault information if the instruction did not execute successfully.

bitField.name: LPAE
bitField.description: When updating the PAR with the result of the translation operation, this bit is set as follows:

bitField.name: F
bitField.description: Indicates whether the instruction performed a successful address translation.

register.name: BPIALL
register.description: Invalidate all entries from branch predictors.

register.name: BPIALLIS
register.gui_name: Branch Predictor Invalidate All, Inner Shareable
register.description: Invalidate all entries from branch predictors Inner Shareable.

register.name: BPIMVA
register.description: Invalidate virtual address from branch predictors.

register.name: DCCIMVAC
register.gui_name: Data Cache line Clean and Invalidate by VA to PoC
register.description: Clean and Invalidate data or unified cache line by virtual address to PoC.

register.name: DCCISW
register.gui_name: Data Cache line Clean and Invalidate by Set/Way
register.description: Clean and Invalidate data or unified cache line by set/way.

bitField.name: SetWay
bitField.description: Contains two fields:

bitField.name: Level
bitField.description: Cache level to operate on, minus 1. For example, this field is 0 for operations on L1 cache, or 1 for operations on L2 cache.

register.name: DCCMVAC
register.gui_name: Data Cache line Clean by VA to PoC
register.description: Clean data or unified cache line by virtual address to PoC.

register.name: DCCMVAU
register.gui_name: Data Cache line Clean by VA to PoU
register.description: Clean data or unified cache line by virtual address to PoU.

register.name: DCCSW
register.gui_name: Data Cache line Clean by Set/Way
register.description: Clean data or unified cache line by set/way.

bitField.name: SetWay
bitField.description: Contains two fields:

bitField.name: Level
bitField.description: Cache level to operate on, minus 1. For example, this field is 0 for operations on L1 cache, or 1 for operations on L2 cache.

register.name: DCIMVAC
register.gui_name: Data Cache line Invalidate by VA to PoC
register.description: Invalidate data or unified cache line by virtual address to PoC.

register.name: DCISW
register.gui_name: Data Cache line Invalidate by Set/Way
register.description: Invalidate data or unified cache line by set/way.

bitField.name: SetWay
bitField.description: Contains two fields:

bitField.name: Level
bitField.description: Cache level to operate on, minus 1. For example, this field is 0 for operations on L1 cache, or 1 for operations on L2 cache.

register.name: ICIALLU
register.gui_name: Instruction Cache Invalidate All to PoU
register.description: Invalidate all instruction caches to PoU. If branch predictors are architecturally visible, also flush branch predictors.

register.name: ICIALLUIS
register.gui_name: Instruction Cache Invalidate All to PoU, Inner Shareable
register.description: Invalidate all instruction caches Inner Shareable to PoU. If branch predictors are architecturally visible, also flush branch predictors.

register.name: ICIMVAU
register.gui_name: Instruction Cache line Invalidate by VA to PoU
register.description: Invalidate instruction cache line by virtual address to PoU.

register.name: DBGAUTHSTATUS
register.description: Provides information about the state of the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED authentication interface for debug.

bitField.name: SNID
bitField.description: Secure non-invasive debug.

bitField.name: SID
bitField.description: Secure invasive debug.

bitField.name: NSNID
bitField.description: Non-secure non-invasive debug.

bitField.name: NSID
bitField.description: Non-secure invasive debug.

register.name: DBGBCR0
register.description: Holds control information for a breakpoint. Forms breakpoint n together with value register DBGBVR<n>. If EL2 is implemented and this breakpoint supports Context matching, DBGBVR<n> can be associated with a Breakpoint Extended Value Register DBGBXVR<n> for VMID matching.

bitField.name: BT
bitField.description: Breakpoint Type.

bitField.name: LBN
bitField.description: Linked breakpoint number. For Linked address matching breakpoints, this specifies the index of the Context-matching breakpoint linked to.

bitField.name: SSC
bitField.description: Security state control. Determines the Security states under which a Breakpoint debug event for breakpoint n is generated. This field must be interpreted along with the HMC and PMC fields, and there are constraints on the permitted values of the {HMC, SSC, PMC} fields. For more information, including the effect of programming the fields to a reserved set of values, see .

bitField.name: HMC
bitField.description: Higher mode control. Determines the debug perspective for deciding when a Breakpoint debug event for breakpoint n is generated. This field must be interpreted along with the SSC and PMC fields, and there are constraints on the permitted values of the {HMC, SSC, PMC} fields. For more information see the SSC, bits [15:14] description.

bitField.name: BAS
bitField.description: Byte address select. Defines which half-words an address-matching breakpoint matches, regardless of the instruction set and Execution state.

bitField.name: PMC
bitField.description: Privilege mode control. Determines the Exception level or levels at which a Breakpoint debug event for breakpoint n is generated. This field must be interpreted along with the SSC and HMC fields, and there are constraints on the permitted values of the {HMC, SSC, PMC} fields. For more information see the DBGBCR<n>.SSC description.

bitField.name: E
bitField.description: Enable breakpoint DBGBVR<n>.

For more information see the SSC, bits [15:14] description.

bitField.name: BAS
bitField.description: Byte address select. Defines which half-words an address-matching breakpoint matches, regardless of the instruction set and Execution state.

bitField.name: PMC
bitField.description: Privilege mode control. Determines the Exception level or levels at which a Breakpoint debug event for breakpoint n is generated. This field must be interpreted along with the SSC and HMC fields, and there are constraints on the permitted values of the {HMC, SSC, PMC} fields. For more information see the DBGBCR<n>.SSC description.

bitField.name: E
bitField.description: Enable breakpoint DBGBVR<n>.

register.name: DBGBCR5
register.description: Holds control information for a breakpoint. Forms breakpoint n together with value register DBGBVR<n>. If EL2 is implemented and this breakpoint supports Context matching, DBGBVR<n> can be associated with a Breakpoint Extended Value Register DBGBXVR<n> for VMID matching.

bitField.name: BT
bitField.description: Breakpoint Type.

bitField.name: LBN
bitField.description: Linked breakpoint number. For Linked address matching breakpoints, this specifies the index of the Context-matching breakpoint linked to.

bitField.name: SSC
bitField.description: Security state control. Determines the Security states under which a Breakpoint debug event for breakpoint n is generated. This field must be interpreted along with the HMC and PMC fields, and there are constraints on the permitted values of the {HMC, SSC, PMC} fields. For more information, including the effect of programming the fields to a reserved set of values, see .

register.name: DBGBVR0
register.description: Holds a value for use in breakpoint matching, either the virtual address of an instruction or a context ID. Forms breakpoint n together with control register DBGBCR<n>. If EL2 is implemented and this breakpoint supports Context matching, DBGBVR<n> can be associated with a Breakpoint Extended Value Register DBGBXVR<n> for VMID matching.

register.description: Holds a value for use in breakpoint matching, to support VMID matching. Used in conjunction with a control register DBGBCR<n> and a value register DBGBVR<n>, where EL2 is implemented and breakpoint n supports Context matching.

bitField.name: VMID
bitField.description: VMID value for comparison.

register.name: DBGBXVR10
register.description: Holds a value for use in breakpoint matching, to support VMID matching. Used in conjunction with a control register DBGBCR<n> and a value register DBGBVR<n>, where EL2 is implemented and breakpoint n supports Context matching.

bitField.name: VMID
bitField.description: VMID value for comparison.

bitField.name: VMID
bitField.description: VMID value for comparison.

bitField.name: VMID
bitField.description: VMID value for comparison.

register.name: DBGBXVR15

bitField.name: VMID
bitField.description: VMID value for comparison.

register.name: DBGCLAIMCLR
register.description: Used by software to read the values of the CLAIM tag bits, and to clear these bits to 0...

bitField.name: CLAIM
bitField.description: Read or clear CLAIM tag bits. Reading this field returns the current value of the CLAIM tag bits.

register.name: DBGCLAIMSET
register.description: Used by software to set the CLAIM tag bits to 1...

bitField.name: CLAIM
bitField.description: Set CLAIM tag bits. RAO.

register.name: DBGDCCINT
register.description: Enables interrupt requests to be signaled based on the DCC status flags.

bitField.name: RX
bitField.description: DCC interrupt request enable control for DTRRX. Enables a common COMMIRQ interrupt request to be signaled based on the DCC status flags.

bitField.name: TX
bitField.description: DCC interrupt request enable control for DTRTX. Enables a common COMMIRQ interrupt request to be signaled based on the DCC status flags.

register.name: DBGDEVID
register.description: Adds to the information given by the DBGDIDR by describing other features of the debug implementation.

bitField.name: CIDMask
bitField.description: Indicates the level of support for the Context ID matching breakpoint masking capability.

bitField.name: AuxRegs
bitField.description: Indicates support for Auxiliary registers.

bitField.name: DoubleLock
bitField.description: Indicates the presence of the DBGOSDLR, OS Double Lock Register.

bitField.name: VirtExtns
bitField.description: Indicates whether EL2 is implemented.

bitField.name: VectorCatch
bitField.description: Defines the form of Vector Catch exception implemented.

bitField.name: BPAddrMask
bitField.description: Indicates the level of support for the instruction address matching breakpoint masking capability.

bitField.name: WPAddrMask
bitField.description: Indicates the level of support for the data address matching watchpoint masking capability.

bitField.name: PCSample
bitField.description: Indicates the level of PC Sample-based Profiling support using external debug registers.

register.name: DBGDEVID1
register.description: Adds to the information given by the DBGDIDR by describing other features of the debug implementation.

bitField.name: PCSROffset
bitField.description: This field indicates the offset applied to PC samples returned by reads of EDPCSR.

register.name: DBGDEVID2
register.description: Reserved for future descriptions of features of the debug implementation.

register.name: DBGDIDR
register.description: Specifies which version of the Debug architecture is implemented, and some features of the debug implementation.

bitField.name: WRPs
bitField.description: The number of watchpoints implemented, minus 1.

bitField.name: BRPs
bitField.description: The number of breakpoints implemented, minus 1.

bitField.name: CTX_CMPs
bitField.description: The number of breakpoints that can be used for Context matching, minus 1.

bitField.name: Version
bitField.description: The Debug architecture version.

bitField.name: nSUHD_imp
bitField.description: In ARMv7-A, was Secure User Halting Debug not implemented.

bitField.name: SE_imp
bitField.description: EL3 implemented.

register.name: DBGDRAR
register.description: Defines the base physical address of a 4KB-aligned memory-mapped debug component, usually a ROM table that locates and describes the memory-mapped debug components in the system. ARMv8 deprecates any use of this register.

bitField.name: ROMADDR_31_12
bitField.description: Bits[31:12] of the ROM table physical address. Bits [11:0] of the address are zero.

bitField.name: Valid
bitField.description: This field indicates whether the ROM Table address is valid.

register.name: DBGDRAR_64
register.description: Defines the base physical address of a 4KB-aligned memory-mapped debug component, usually a ROM table that locates and describes the memory-mapped debug components in the system. ARMv8 deprecates any use of this register.

bitField.name: ROMADDR_47_12
bitField.description: Bits[47:12] of the ROM table physical address.

bitField.name: Valid
bitField.description: This field indicates whether the ROM Table address is valid.

register.name: DBGDSAR
register.description: In earlier versions of the ARM Architecture, this register defines the offset from the base address defined in DBGDRAR of the physical base address of the debug registers for the PE. ARMv8 deprecates any use of this register.

bitField.name: Offset
bitField.description: This register value is RAZ.

register.name: DBGDSAR_64
register.description: In earlier versions of the ARM Architecture, this register defines the offset from the base address defined in DBGDRAR of the physical base address of the debug registers for the PE. ARMv8 deprecates any use of this register.

bitField.name: Offset
bitField.description: This register value is RAZ.

register.name: DBGDSCRext
register.gui_name: Debug Status and Control Register, External View
register.description: Main control register for the debug implementation.

bitField.name: RXfull
bitField.description: DTRRX full. Used for save/restore of EDSCR.RXfull.

bitField.name: TXfull
bitField.description: DTRTX full. Used for save/restore of EDSCR.TXfull.

bitField.name: RXO
bitField.description: Used for save/restore of EDSCR.RXO.

bitField.name: TXU
bitField.description: Used for save/restore of EDSCR.TXU.

bitField.name: INTdis
bitField.description: Used for save/restore of EDSCR.INTdis.

bitField.name: TDA
bitField.description: Used for save/restore of EDSCR.TDA.

bitField.name: NS
bitField.description: Non-secure status. Returns the inverse of IsSecure(). This bit is RO.

bitField.name: SPNIDdis
bitField.description: Secure privileged profiling disabled status bit. This bit is RO.

bitField.name: SPIDdis
bitField.description: Secure privileged AArch32 invasive self-hosted debug disabled status bit. This bit is RO and depends on the value of SDCR.SPD and the pseudocode function AArch32.SelfHostedSecurePrivilegedInvasiveDebugEnabled().

bitField.name: MDBGen
bitField.description: Monitor debug events enable. Enable Breakpoint, Watchpoint, and Vector Catch exceptions.

bitField.name: HDE
bitField.description: Used for save/restore of EDSCR.HDE.

bitField.name: UDCCdis
bitField.description: Traps EL0 accesses to the DCC registers to Undefined mode.

bitField.name: ERR
bitField.description: Used for save/restore of EDSCR.ERR.

bitField.name: MOE
bitField.description: Method of Entry for debug exception.

register.name: DBGDSCRint
register.gui_name: Debug Status and Control Register, Internal View
register.description: Main control register for the debug implementation. This is an internal, read-only view.

bitField.name: RXfull
bitField.description: DTRRX full. Read-only view of the equivalent bit in the EDSCR.

bitField.name: TXfull
bitField.description: DTRTX full. Read-only view of the equivalent bit in the EDSCR.

bitField.name: NS
bitField.description: Non-secure status.

bitField.name: SPNIDdis
bitField.description: Secure privileged non-invasive debug disable.

bitField.name: SPIDdis
bitField.description: Secure privileged invasive debug disable.

bitField.name: MDBGen
bitField.description: Monitor debug events enable.

bitField.name: UDCCdis
bitField.description: User mode access to Debug Communications Channel disable.

bitField.name: MOE
bitField.description: Method of Entry for debug exception.

register.name: DBGOSDLR
register.description: Locks out the external debug interface.

bitField.name: DLK
bitField.description: OS Double Lock control bit.

register.name: DBGOSECCR
register.gui_name: Debug OS Lock Exception Catch Control Register
register.description: Provides a mechanism for an operating system to access the contents of EDECCR that are otherwise invisible to software, so it can save/restore the contents of EDECCR over powerdown on behalf of the external debugger.

bitField.name: EDECCR
bitField.description: Used for save/restore to EDECCR over powerdown.

register.name: DBGOSLAR
register.description: Provides a lock for the debug registers. The OS lock also disables some Software debug events.

register.name: DBGOSLSR
register.description: Provides status information for the OS lock.

bitField.name: OSLM_1
bitField.description: See below for description of the OSLM field.

bitField.name: nTT
bitField.description: Not 32-bit access. This bit is always RAZ. It indicates that a 32-bit access is needed to write the key to the OS Lock Access Register.

bitField.name: OSLK
bitField.description: OS Lock Status.

bitField.name: OSLM_0
bitField.description: OS lock model implemented. Identifies the form of OS save and restore mechanism implemented.

register.name: DBGPRCR
register.description: Controls behavior of the PE on powerdown request.

bitField.name: CORENPDRQ
bitField.description: Core no powerdown request. Requests emulation of powerdown.

register.name: DBGVCR
register.description: Controls Vector Catch debug events.

register.name: DBGWCR0
register.description: Holds control information for a watchpoint. Forms watchpoint n together with value register DBGWVR<n>.

bitField.name: MASK
bitField.description: Address mask. Only objects up to 2GB can be watched using a single mask.

bitField.name: WT
bitField.description: Watchpoint type.

bitField.name: LBN
bitField.description: Linked breakpoint number. For Linked data address watchpoints, this specifies the index of the Context-matching breakpoint linked to.

bitField.name: SSC
bitField.description: Security state control. Determines the Security states under which a Watchpoint debug event for watchpoint n is generated. This field must be interpreted along with the HMC and PAC fields.

bitField.name: HMC
bitField.description: Higher mode control. Determines the debug perspective for deciding when a Watchpoint debug event for watchpoint n is generated. This field must be interpreted along with the SSC and PAC fields.

bitField.name: BAS
bitField.description: Byte address select. Each bit of this field selects whether a byte from within the word or double-word addressed by DBGWVR<n> is being watched.

bitField.name: LSC
bitField.description: Load/store control. This field enables watchpoint matching on the type of access being made.

bitField.name: PAC
bitField.description: Privilege of access control. Determines the Exception level or levels at which a Watchpoint debug event for watchpoint n is generated. This field must be interpreted along with the SSC and HMC fields.

bitField.name: E
bitField.description: Enable watchpoint n.

bitField.description: Byte address select. Each bit of this field selects whether a byte from within the word or double-word addressed by DBGWVR<n> is being watched.

bitField.name: LSC
bitField.description: Load/store control. This field enables watchpoint matching on the type of access being made.

bitField.name: PAC
bitField.description: Privilege of access control. Determines the Exception level or levels at which a Watchpoint debug event for watchpoint n is generated. This field must be interpreted along with the SSC and HMC fields.

bitField.name: E
bitField.description: Enable watchpoint n.

register.name: DBGWCR13
register.description: Holds control information for a watchpoint. Forms watchpoint n together with value register DBGWVR<n>.

bitField.name: MASK
bitField.description: Address mask. Only objects up to 2GB can be watched using a single mask.

bitField.name: WT
bitField.description: Watchpoint type.

bitField.name: LBN
bitField.description: Linked breakpoint number. For Linked data address watchpoints, this specifies the index of the Context-matching breakpoint linked to.

bitField.name: SSC
bitField.description: Security state control. Determines the Security states under which a Watchpoint debug event for watchpoint n is generated. This field must be interpreted along with the HMC and PAC fields.

register.name: HDCR
register.description: Controls the trapping to Hyp mode of Non-secure accesses, at EL1 or lower, to functions provided by the debug and trace architectures and the Performance Monitors Extension.

bitField.name: TDRA
bitField.description: Trap Debug ROM Address register access. Traps Non-secure EL0 and EL1 System register accesses to the Debug ROM registers to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TDOSA
bitField.description: Trap debug OS-related register access. Traps Non-secure EL1 System register accesses to the powerdown debug registers to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TDA
bitField.description: Trap debug access.

bitField.name: TDE
bitField.description: Trap Debug exceptions.

bitField.name: HPME
bitField.description: Hypervisor Performance Monitors Enable.

bitField.name: TPM
bitField.description: Trap Performance Monitors accesses. Traps Non-secure EL0 and EL1 accesses to all Performance Monitors registers to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TPMCR
bitField.description: Trap PMCR accesses. Traps Non-secure EL0 and EL1 accesses to the PMCR to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: HPMN
bitField.description: Defines the number of Performance Monitors counters that are accessible from Non-secure EL1 modes, and from Non-secure EL0 modes if unprivileged access is enabled.

register.name: SDCR
register.description: When EL3 is implemented and can use AArch32, controls debug and performance monitors functionality in Secure state.

bitField.name: EPMAD
bitField.description: External debug interface Performance Monitors registers disable.

bitField.name: EDAD
bitField.description: External debug interface breakpoint and watchpoint register access disable.

bitField.name: SPME
bitField.description: Secure Performance Monitors enable.

bitField.name: SPD
bitField.description: AArch32 Secure privileged debug. Enables or disables debug exceptions from Secure state, other than Breakpoint Instruction exceptions.

register.name: SDER
register.description: Controls invasive and non-invasive debug in the Secure EL0 mode.

bitField.name: SUNIDEN
bitField.description: Secure User Non-Invasive Debug Enable:

bitField.name: SUIDEN
bitField.description: Secure User Invasive Debug Enable:

register.name: ADFSR
register.description: Provides additional IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED fault status information for Data Abort exceptions taken to EL1 modes, and EL3 modes when EL3 is implemented and is using AArch32.

register.name: S_ADFSR
register.description: Provides additional IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED fault status information for Data Abort exceptions taken to EL1 modes, and EL3 modes when EL3 is implemented and is using AArch32.

register.name: N_ADFSR
register.description: Provides additional IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED fault status information for Data Abort exceptions taken to EL1 modes, and EL3 modes when EL3 is implemented and is using AArch32.

register.name: AIFSR
register.description: Provides additional IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED fault status information for Prefetch Abort exceptions taken to EL1 modes, and EL3 modes when EL3 is implemented and is using AArch32.

register.name: S_AIFSR

register.name: N_AIFSR
register.description: Provides additional IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED fault status information for Prefetch Abort exceptions taken to EL1 modes, and EL3 modes when EL3 is implemented and is using AArch32.

register.name: DFAR
register.description: Holds the virtual address of the faulting address that caused a synchronous Data Abort exception.

register.name: S_DFAR
register.description: Holds the virtual address of the faulting address that caused a synchronous Data Abort exception.

register.name: N_DFAR
register.description: Holds the virtual address of the faulting address that caused a synchronous Data Abort exception.

register.name: DFSR
register.description: Holds status information about the last data fault.

bitField.name: FnV
bitField.description: FAR not Valid, for a Synchronous external abort other than a Synchronous external abort on a translation table walk.

bitField.name: AET
bitField.description: Asynchronous Error Type. When the RAS Extension is implemented, this field describes the state of the PE after taking an asynchronous Data Abort exception.

bitField.name: CM
bitField.description: Cache maintenance fault. For synchronous faults, this bit indicates whether a cache maintenance instruction generated the fault.

bitField.name: ExT
bitField.description: External abort type. This bit can be used to provide an IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED classification of external aborts.

bitField.name: WnR
bitField.description: Write not Read bit. Indicates whether the abort was caused by a write or a read instruction.

bitField.name: LPAE
bitField.description: On taking a Data Abort exception, this bit is set as follows:

register.name: HADFSR

register.description: Provides additional IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED syndrome information for Data Abort exceptions taken to Hyp mode.

register.name: HAIFSR

register.description: Provides additional IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED syndrome information for Prefetch Abort exceptions taken to Hyp mode.

register.name: HDFAR
register.description: Holds the virtual address of the faulting address that caused a synchronous Data Abort exception that is taken to Hyp mode.

register.name: HIFAR
register.description: Holds the virtual address of the faulting address that caused a synchronous Prefetch Abort exception that is taken to Hyp mode.

register.name: HPFAR
register.description: Holds the faulting IPA for some aborts on a stage 2 translation taken to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: FIPA_39_12
bitField.description: Bits [39:12] of the faulting intermediate physical address.

register.name: HSR
register.description: Holds syndrome information for an exception taken to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: EC
bitField.description: Exception Class. Indicates the reason for the exception that this register holds information about.

bitField.name: IL
bitField.description: Instruction length bit. Indicates the size of the instruction that has been trapped to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: CV
bitField.description: Condition code valid.

bitField.name: COND
bitField.description: The condition code for the trapped instruction.

bitField.name: TI
bitField.description: Trapped instruction.

bitField.name: CV
bitField.description: Condition code valid.

bitField.name: COND
bitField.description: The condition code for the trapped instruction.

bitField.name: Opc2
bitField.description: The Opc2 value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Opc1
bitField.description: The Opc1 value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: CRn
bitField.description: The CRn value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Rt
bitField.description: The Rt value from the issued instruction, the general-purpose register used for the transfer.

bitField.name: CRm
bitField.description: The CRm value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Direction
bitField.description: Indicates the direction of the trapped instruction.

bitField.name: CV
bitField.description: Condition code valid.

bitField.name: COND
bitField.description: The condition code for the trapped instruction.

bitField.name: Opc1
bitField.description: The Opc1 value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Rt2
bitField.description: The Rt2 value from the issued instruction, the second general-purpose register used for the transfer.

bitField.name: Rt
bitField.description: The Rt value from the issued instruction, the first general-purpose register used for the transfer.

bitField.name: CRm
bitField.description: The CRm value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Direction
bitField.description: Indicates the direction of the trapped instruction.

bitField.name: CV
bitField.description: Condition code valid.

bitField.name: COND
bitField.description: The condition code for the trapped instruction.

bitField.name: imm8
bitField.description: The immediate value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Rn
bitField.description: The Rn value from the issued instruction. Valid only when AM[2] is 0, indicating an immediate form of the LDC or STC instruction.

bitField.name: Offset
bitField.description: Indicates whether the offset is added or subtracted:

bitField.name: AM
bitField.description: Addressing mode.

bitField.name: Direction
bitField.description: Indicates the direction of the trapped instruction.

bitField.name: CV
bitField.description: Condition code valid.

bitField.name: COND
bitField.description: The condition code for the trapped instruction.

bitField.name: TA
bitField.description: Indicates trapped use of Advanced SIMD functionality.

bitField.name: coproc
bitField.description: When the TA field returns the value 1, this field returns the value 1010, otherwise this field is RES0.

bitField.name: imm16
bitField.description: The value of the immediate field from the HVC or SVC instruction.

bitField.name: CV
bitField.description: Condition code valid.

bitField.name: COND
bitField.description: The condition code for the trapped instruction.

bitField.name: CCKNOWNPASS
bitField.description: Indicates whether the instruction might have failed its condition code check.

bitField.name: FnV
bitField.description: FAR not Valid, for a Synchronous external abort other than a Synchronous external abort on a translation table walk.

bitField.name: EA
bitField.description: External abort type. This bit can provide an IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED classification of External aborts.

bitField.name: S1PTW
bitField.description: For a stage 2 fault, indicates whether the fault was a stage 2 fault on an access made for a stage 1 translation table walk:

bitField.name: IFSC
bitField.description: Instruction Fault Status Code.

bitField.name: ISV
bitField.description: Instruction syndrome valid. Indicates whether the syndrome information in ISS[23:14] is valid.

bitField.name: SAS
bitField.description: Syndrome Access Size. When ISV is 1, indicates the size of the access attempted by the faulting operation.

bitField.name: SSE
bitField.description: Syndrome Sign Extend. When ISV is 1, for a byte, halfword, or word load operation, indicates whether the data item must be sign extended.

bitField.name: SRT
bitField.description: Syndrome Register transfer. When ISV is 1, the register number of the Rt operand of the faulting instruction.

bitField.name: AR
bitField.description: Acquire/Release.

bitField.name: AET
bitField.description: Asynchronous Error Type.

bitField.name: FnV
bitField.description: FAR not Valid, for a Synchronous external abort other than a Synchronous external abort on a translation table walk.

bitField.name: EA
bitField.description: External abort type. This bit can provide an IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED classification of External aborts.

bitField.name: CM
bitField.description: Cache maintenance. For a synchronous fault, identifies fault that comes from a cache maintenance or address translation instruction.

bitField.name: S1PTW
bitField.description: For a stage 2 fault, indicates whether the fault was a stage 2 fault on an access made for a stage 1 translation table walk:

bitField.name: WnR
bitField.description: Write not Read. Indicates whether a synchronous abort was caused by a write instruction or a read instruction.

bitField.name: DFSC
bitField.description: Data Fault Status Code.

register.name: ISR
register.description: Shows whether any IRQ, FIQ, or external abort is pending. In an implementation that includes EL2, when the register is accessed from Non-secure EL1, a pending interrupt might be a physical interrupt or a virtual interrupt, and the architecture does not provide any mechanism that software executing at Non-secure EL1 can use to determine whether a pending interrupt is physical or virtual. For all other accesses, any indicated interrupt must be a physical interrupt.

bitField.name: A
bitField.description: Asynchronous external abort pending bit:

bitField.name: I
bitField.description: IRQ pending bit.

bitField.name: F
bitField.description: FIQ pending bit. Indicates whether an FIQ interrupt is pending.

register.name: MVBAR
register.description: When EL3 is implemented and can use AArch32, holds the vector base address for any exception that is taken to Monitor mode...

bitField.name: Reserved
bitField.description: Reserved, see Configurations.

register.name: VBAR
register.description: When high exception vectors are not selected, holds the vector base address for exceptions that are not taken to Monitor mode or to Hyp mode...

register.name: S_VBAR
register.description: When high exception vectors are not selected, holds the vector base address for exceptions that are not taken to Monitor mode or to Hyp mode...

register.name: N_VBAR
register.description: When high exception vectors are not selected, holds the vector base address for exceptions that are not taken to Monitor mode or to Hyp mode...

register.name: FPEXC
register.description: Provides a global enable for the implemented Advanced SIMD and floating-point functionality, and reports floating-point status information.

bitField.name: EX
bitField.description: Exception bit. In ARMv8, this bit is RAZ/WI.

bitField.name: EN
bitField.description: Enables access to the Advanced SIMD and floating-point functionality from all Exception levels, except that setting this field to 0 does not disable the following:

bitField.name: DEX
bitField.description: Defined synchronous exception on floating-point execution.

bitField.name: FP2V
bitField.description: FPINST2 instruction valid bit. In ARMv8, this bit is RES0.

bitField.name: VV
bitField.description: VECITR valid bit. In ARMv8, this bit is RES0.

bitField.name: TFV
bitField.description: Trapped Fault Valid bit. Valid only when the value of FPEXC.DEX is 1. When valid, it indicates the cause of the exception and therefore whether the FPEXC.{IDF, IXF, UFF, OFF, DZF, IOF} bits are valid.

bitField.name: VECITR
bitField.description: Vector iteration count. In ARMv8, this field is RES1.

bitField.name: IDF
bitField.description: Input Denormal trapped exception bit. Valid only when the value of FPEXC.TFV is 1. When valid, it indicates whether an Input Denormal exception occurred while FPSCR.

bitField.name: IXF
bitField.description: Inexact trapped exception bit. Valid only when the value of FPEXC.TFV is 1. When valid, it indicates whether an Inexact exception occurred while FPSCR.

bitField.name: UFF
bitField.description: Underflow trapped exception bit. Valid only when the value of FPEXC.TFV is 1. When valid, it indicates whether an Underflow exception occurred while FPSCR.

bitField.name: OFF
bitField.description: Overflow trapped exception bit. Valid only when the value of FPEXC.TFV is 1. When valid, it indicates whether an Overflow exception occurred while FPSCR.

bitField.name: DZF
bitField.description: Divide by Zero trapped exception bit. Valid only when the value of FPEXC.TFV is 1. When valid, it indicates whether a Divide by Zero exception occurred while FPSCR.

bitField.name: IOF
bitField.description: Invalid Operation trapped exception bit. Valid only when the value of FPEXC.TFV is 1. When valid, it indicates whether an Invalid Operation exception occurred while FPSCR.

register.name: FPSCR
register.description: Provides floating-point system status information and control.

bitField.name: N
bitField.description: Negative condition flag. This is updated by floating-point comparison operations.

bitField.name: Z
bitField.description: Zero condition flag. This is updated by floating-point comparison operations.

bitField.name: C
bitField.description: Carry condition flag. This is updated by floating-point comparison operations.

bitField.name: V
bitField.description: Overflow condition flag. This is updated by floating-point comparison operations.

bitField.name: QC
bitField.description: Cumulative saturation bit, Advanced SIMD only. This bit is set to 1 to indicate that an Advanced SIMD integer operation has saturated since 0 was last written to this bit.

bitField.name: AHP
bitField.description: Alternative half-precision control bit:

bitField.name: DN
bitField.description: Default NaN mode control bit:

bitField.name: FZ
bitField.description: Flush-to-zero mode control bit:

bitField.name: RMode
bitField.description: Rounding Mode control field.

bitField.name: Stride
bitField.description: It is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED whether this field is RW or RAZ.

bitField.name: Len
bitField.description: It is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED whether this field is RW or RAZ.

bitField.name: IDE
bitField.description: Input Denormal floating-point exception trap enable.

bitField.name: IXE
bitField.description: Inexact floating-point exception trap enable.

bitField.name: UFE
bitField.description: Underflow floating-point exception trap enable.

bitField.name: OFE
bitField.description: Overflow floating-point exception trap enable.

bitField.name: DZE
bitField.description: Divide by Zero floating-point exception trap enable.

bitField.name: IOE
bitField.description: Invalid Operation floating-point exception trap enable.

bitField.name: IDC
bitField.description: Input Denormal cumulative floating-point exception bit. This bit is set to 1 to indicate that the Input Denormal floating-point exception has occurred since 0 was last written to this bit.

bitField.name: IXC
bitField.description: Inexact cumulative floating-point exception bit. This bit is set to 1 to indicate that the Inexact floating-point exception has occurred since 0 was last written to this bit.

bitField.name: UFC
bitField.description: Underflow cumulative floating-point exception bit. This bit is set to 1 to indicate that the Underflow floating-point exception has occurred since 0 was last written to this bit.

bitField.name: OFC
bitField.description: Overflow cumulative floating-point exception bit. This bit is set to 1 to indicate that the Overflow floating-point exception has occurred since 0 was last written to this bit.

bitField.name: DZC
bitField.description: Divide by Zero cumulative floating-point exception bit. This bit is set to 1 to indicate that the Divide by Zero floating-point exception has occurred since 0 was last written to this bit.

bitField.name: IOC
bitField.description: Invalid Operation cumulative floating-point exception bit. This bit is set to 1 to indicate that the Invalid Operation floating-point exception has occurred since 0 was last written to this bit.

register.name: FPSID
register.description: Provides top-level information about the floating-point implementation...

bitField.name: Implementer
bitField.description: Implementer codes are the same as those used for the MIDR.

bitField.name: SW
bitField.description: Software bit.

bitField.name: Subarchitecture
bitField.description: Subarchitecture version number.

bitField.name: PartNum
bitField.description: An IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED part number for the floating-point implementation, assigned by the implementer.

bitField.name: Variant
bitField.description: An IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED variant number. Typically, this field distinguishes between different production variants of a single product.

bitField.name: Revision
bitField.description: An IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED revision number for the floating-point implementation.

register.name: MVFR0
register.description: Describes the features provided by the AArch32 Advanced SIMD and Floating-point implementation...

bitField.name: FPRound
bitField.description: Floating-Point Rounding modes. Indicates whether the floating-point implementation provides support for rounding modes.

bitField.name: FPShVec
bitField.description: Short Vectors. Indicates whether the floating-point implementation provides support for the use of short vectors.

bitField.name: FPSqrt
bitField.description: Square Root. Indicates whether the floating-point implementation provides support for the ARMv6 VFP square root operations.

bitField.name: FPDivide
bitField.description: Indicates whether the floating-point implementation provides support for VFP divide operations.

bitField.name: FPTrap
bitField.description: Floating Point Exception Trapping. Indicates whether the floating-point implementation provides support for exception trapping.

bitField.name: FPDP
bitField.description: Double Precision. Indicates whether the floating-point implementation provides support for double-precision operations.

bitField.name: FPSP
bitField.description: Single Precision. Indicates whether the floating-point implementation provides support for single-precision operations.

bitField.name: SIMDReg
bitField.description: Advanced SIMD registers. Indicates whether the Advanced SIMD and floating-point implementation provides support for the Advanced SIMD and floating-point register bank.

register.name: MVFR1
register.description: Describes the features provided by the AArch32 Advanced SIMD and Floating-point implementation...

bitField.name: SIMDFMAC
bitField.description: Advanced SIMD Fused Multiply-Accumulate. Indicates whether the Advanced SIMD implementation provides fused multiply accumulate instructions.

bitField.name: FPHP
bitField.description: Floating Point Half Precision. Indicates whether the floating-point implementation provides half-precision floating-point conversion instructions.

bitField.name: SIMDHP
bitField.description: Advanced SIMD Half Precision. Indicates whether the Advanced SIMD and floating-point implementation provides half-precision floating-point conversion instructions.

bitField.name: SIMDSP
bitField.description: Advanced SIMD Single Precision. Indicates whether the Advanced SIMD and floating-point implementation provides single-precision floating-point instructions.

bitField.name: SIMDInt
bitField.description: Advanced SIMD Integer. Indicates whether the Advanced SIMD and floating-point implementation provides integer instructions.

bitField.name: SIMDLS
bitField.description: Advanced SIMD Load/Store. Indicates whether the Advanced SIMD and floating-point implementation provides load/store instructions.

bitField.name: FPDNaN
bitField.description: Default NaN mode. Indicates whether the floating-point implementation provides support only for the Default NaN mode.

bitField.name: FPFtZ
bitField.description: Flush to Zero mode. Indicates whether the floating-point implementation provides support only for the Flush-to-Zero mode of operation.

register.name: MVFR2
register.description: Describes the features provided by the AArch32 Advanced SIMD and Floating-point implementation...

bitField.name: FPMisc
bitField.description: Indicates whether the floating-point implementation provides support for miscellaneous VFP features.

bitField.name: SIMDMisc
bitField.description: Indicates whether the Advanced SIMD implementation provides support for miscellaneous Advanced SIMD features.

register.name: ICC_ASGI1R
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Alias Software Generated Interrupt Group 1 Register
register.description: Generates Group 1 SGIs for the Security state that is not the current Security state.

bitField.name: Aff3
bitField.description: The affinity 3 value of the affinity path of the cluster for which SGI interrupts will be generated.

bitField.name: IRM
bitField.description: Interrupt Routing Mode. Determines how the generated interrupts are distributed to PEs.

bitField.name: Aff2
bitField.description: The affinity 2 value of the affinity path of the cluster for which SGI interrupts will be generated.

bitField.name: INTID
bitField.description: The INTID of the SGI.

bitField.name: Aff1
bitField.description: The affinity 1 value of the affinity path of the cluster for which SGI interrupts will be generated.

bitField.name: TargetList
bitField.description: Target List. The set of PEs for which SGI interrupts will be generated. Each bit corresponds to the PE within a cluster with an Affinity 0 value equal to the bit number.

register.name: ICC_BPR0
register.description: Defines the point at which the priority value fields split into two parts, the group priority field and the subpriority field. The group priority field determines Group 0 interrupt preemption.

bitField.name: BinaryPoint
bitField.description: The value of this field controls how the 8-bit interrupt priority field is split into a group priority field, that determines interrupt preemption, and a subpriority field.

register.name: ICC_BPR1
register.description: Defines the point at which the priority value fields split into two parts, the group priority field and the subpriority field. The group priority field determines Group 1 interrupt preemption.

bitField.name: BinaryPoint
bitField.description: If the GIC is configured to use separate binary point fields for Group 0 and Group 1 interrupts, the value of this field controls how the 8-bit interrupt priority field is split into a group priority field, that determines interrupt preemption, and a subpriority field. For more information about priorities, see .

register.name: S_ICC_BPR1
register.description: Defines the point at which the priority value fields split into two parts, the group priority field and the subpriority field. The group priority field determines Group 1 interrupt preemption.

bitField.name: BinaryPoint
bitField.description: If the GIC is configured to use separate binary point fields for Group 0 and Group 1 interrupts, the value of this field controls how the 8-bit interrupt priority field is split into a group priority field, that determines interrupt preemption, and a subpriority field. For more information about priorities, see .

register.name: N_ICC_BPR1
register.description: Defines the point at which the priority value fields split into two parts, the group priority field and the subpriority field. The group priority field determines Group 1 interrupt preemption.

bitField.name: BinaryPoint
bitField.description: If the GIC is configured to use separate binary point fields for Group 0 and Group 1 interrupts, the value of this field controls how the 8-bit interrupt priority field is split into a group priority field, that determines interrupt preemption, and a subpriority field. For more information about priorities, see .

register.name: ICC_CTLR
register.description: Controls aspects of the behavior of the GIC CPU interface and provides information about the features implemented.

bitField.name: A3V
bitField.description: Affinity 3 Valid. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: SEIS
bitField.description: SEI Support. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: IDbits
bitField.description: Identifier bits. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: PRIbits
bitField.description: Priority bits. Read-only and writes are ignored. The number of priority bits implemented, minus one.

bitField.name: PMHE
bitField.description: Priority Mask Hint Enable.

bitField.name: EOImode
bitField.description: EOI mode for the current Security state.

bitField.name: CBPR
bitField.description: Common Binary Point Register.

register.name: ICC_DIR
register.description: When interrupt priority drop is separated from interrupt deactivation, a write to this register deactivates the specified interrupt.

bitField.name: INTID
bitField.description: The INTID of the interrupt to be deactivated.

register.name: ICC_EOIR0
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller End Of Interrupt Register 0
register.description: A PE writes to this register to inform the CPU interface that it has completed the processing of the specified Group 0 interrupt.

bitField.name: INTID
bitField.description: The INTID from the corresponding ICC_IAR0 access.

register.name: ICC_EOIR1
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller End Of Interrupt Register 1
register.description: A PE writes to this register to inform the CPU interface that it has completed the processing of the specified Group 1 interrupt.

bitField.name: INTID
bitField.description: The INTID from the corresponding ICC_IAR1 access.

register.name: ICC_HPPIR0
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Highest Priority Pending Interrupt Register 0
register.description: Indicates the highest priority pending Group 0 interrupt on the CPU interface.

bitField.name: INTID
bitField.description: The INTID of the highest priority pending interrupt, if that interrupt is observable at the current Security state and Exception level.

register.name: ICC_HPPIR1
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Highest Priority Pending Interrupt Register 1
register.description: Indicates the highest priority pending Group 1 interrupt on the CPU interface.

bitField.name: INTID
bitField.description: The INTID of the highest priority pending interrupt, if that interrupt is observable at the current Security state and Exception level.

register.name: ICC_HSRE
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Hyp System Register Enable register
register.description: Controls whether the System register interface or the memory-mapped interface to the GIC CPU interface is used for EL2.

bitField.name: Enable
bitField.description: Enable. Enables lower Exception level access to ICC_SRE.

bitField.name: DIB
bitField.description: Disable IRQ bypass.

bitField.name: DFB
bitField.description: Disable FIQ bypass.

bitField.name: SRE
bitField.description: System Register Enable.

register.name: ICC_IGRPEN0
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Interrupt Group 0 Enable register
register.description: Controls whether Group 0 interrupts are enabled or not.

bitField.name: Enable
bitField.description: Enables Group 0 interrupts.

register.name: ICC_IGRPEN1
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Interrupt Group 1 Enable register
register.description: Controls whether Group 1 interrupts are enabled for the current Security state.

bitField.name: Enable
bitField.description: Enables Group 1 interrupts for the current Security state.

register.name: S_ICC_IGRPEN1
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Interrupt Group 1 Enable register
register.description: Controls whether Group 1 interrupts are enabled for the current Security state.

bitField.name: Enable
bitField.description: Enables Group 1 interrupts for the current Security state.

register.name: N_ICC_IGRPEN1
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Interrupt Group 1 Enable register
register.description: Controls whether Group 1 interrupts are enabled for the current Security state.

bitField.name: Enable
bitField.description: Enables Group 1 interrupts for the current Security state.

register.name: ICC_MCTLR
register.description: Controls aspects of the behavior of the GIC CPU interface and provides information about the features implemented.

bitField.name: nDS
bitField.description: Disable Security not supported. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: A3V
bitField.description: Affinity 3 Valid. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: SEIS
bitField.description: SEI Support. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: IDbits
bitField.description: Identifier bits. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: PRIbits
bitField.description: Priority bits. Read-only and writes are ignored. The number of priority bits implemented, minus one.

bitField.name: PMHE
bitField.description: Priority Mask Hint Enable.

bitField.name: RM
bitField.description: SBZ.

bitField.name: EOImode_EL1NS
bitField.description: EOI mode for interrupts handled at Non-secure EL1 and EL2.

bitField.name: EOImode_EL1S
bitField.description: EOI mode for interrupts handled at Secure EL1.

bitField.name: EOImode_EL3
bitField.description: EOI mode for interrupts handled at EL3.

bitField.name: CBPR_EL1NS
bitField.description: Common Binary Point Register, EL1 Non-secure.

bitField.name: CBPR_EL1S
bitField.description: Common Binary Point Register, EL1 Secure.

register.name: ICC_MGRPEN1
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Monitor Interrupt Group 1 Enable register
register.description: Controls whether Group 1 interrupts are enabled or not.

bitField.name: EnableGrp1S
bitField.description: Enables Group 1 interrupts for the Secure state.

bitField.name: EnableGrp1NS
bitField.description: Enables Group 1 interrupts for the Non-secure state.

register.name: ICC_MSRE
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Monitor System Register Enable register
register.description: Controls whether the System register interface or the memory-mapped interface to the GIC CPU interface is used for EL3.

bitField.name: Enable
bitField.description: Enable. Enables lower Exception level access to ICC_SRE and ICC_HSRE.

bitField.name: DIB
bitField.description: Disable IRQ bypass.

bitField.name: DFB
bitField.description: Disable FIQ bypass.

bitField.name: SRE
bitField.description: System Register Enable.

register.name: ICC_PMR
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Interrupt Priority Mask Register
register.description: Provides an interrupt priority filter. Only interrupts with a higher priority than the value in this register are signaled to the PE.

bitField.name: Priority
bitField.description: The priority mask level for the CPU interface. If the priority of an interrupt is higher than the value indicated by this field, the interface signals the interrupt to the PE.

register.name: ICC_RPR
register.description: Indicates the Running priority of the CPU interface.

bitField.name: Priority
bitField.description: The current running priority on the CPU interface. This is the group priority of the current active interrupt.

register.name: ICC_SGI0R

register.description: Generates Secure Group 0 SGIs.

bitField.name: Aff2
bitField.description: The affinity 2 value of the affinity path of the cluster for which SGI interrupts will be generated.

bitField.name: INTID
bitField.description: The INTID of the SGI.

bitField.name: Aff1
bitField.description: The affinity 1 value of the affinity path of the cluster for which SGI interrupts will be generated.

bitField.name: TargetList
bitField.description: Target List. The set of PEs for which SGI interrupts will be generated. Each bit corresponds to the PE within a cluster with an Affinity 0 value equal to the bit number.

register.name: ICH_HCR
register.description: Controls the environment for VMs.

bitField.name: EOIcount
bitField.description: This field is incremented whenever a successful write to a virtual EOIR or DIR register would have resulted in a virtual interrupt deactivation.

bitField.name: TDIR
bitField.description: Trap Non-secure EL1 writes to ICC_DIR and ICV_DIR.

bitField.name: TSEI
bitField.description: Trap all locally generated SEIs. This bit allows the hypervisor to intercept locally generated SEIs that would otherwise be taken at Non-secure EL1.

bitField.name: TALL1
bitField.description: Trap all Non-secure EL1 accesses to ICC_* and ICV_* System registers for Group 1 interrupts to EL2.

bitField.name: TALL0
bitField.description: Trap all Non-secure EL1 accesses to ICC_* and ICV_* System registers for Group 0 interrupts to EL2.

bitField.name: TC
bitField.description: Trap all Non-secure EL1 accesses to System registers that are common to Group 0 and Group 1 to EL2.

bitField.name: VGrp1DIE
bitField.description: VM Group 1 Disabled Interrupt Enable.

bitField.name: VGrp1EIE
bitField.description: VM Group 1 Enabled Interrupt Enable.

bitField.name: VGrp0DIE
bitField.description: VM Group 0 Disabled Interrupt Enable.

bitField.name: VGrp0EIE
bitField.description: VM Group 0 Enabled Interrupt Enable.

bitField.name: NPIE
bitField.description: No Pending Interrupt Enable.

bitField.name: LRENPIE
bitField.description: List Register Entry Not Present Interrupt Enable.

bitField.name: UIE
bitField.description: Underflow Interrupt Enable.

bitField.name: En
bitField.description: Enable.

register.name: ICH_LRC0
register.description: Provides interrupt context information for the virtual CPU interface.

bitField.name: State
bitField.description: The state of the interrupt:

bitField.name: HW
bitField.description: Indicates whether this virtual interrupt maps directly to a hardware interrupt, meaning that it corresponds to a physical interrupt. Deactivation of the virtual interrupt also causes the deactivation of the physical interrupt with the INTID that the pINTID field indicates.

bitField.name: Group
bitField.description: Indicates the group for this virtual interrupt.

bitField.name: Priority
bitField.description: The priority of this interrupt.

bitField.name: pINTID
bitField.description: Physical INTID, for hardware interrupts.
