register.name: ICH_MISR
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Maintenance Interrupt State Register
register.description: Indicates which maintenance interrupts are asserted.

bitField.name: VGrp1D
bitField.description: vPE Group 1 Disabled.

bitField.name: VGrp1E
bitField.description: vPE Group 1 Enabled.

bitField.name: VGrp0D
bitField.description: vPE Group 0 Disabled.

bitField.name: VGrp0E
bitField.description: vPE Group 0 Enabled.

bitField.name: NP
bitField.description: No Pending.

bitField.name: LRENP
bitField.description: List Register Entry Not Present.

bitField.name: U
bitField.description: Underflow.

bitField.name: EOI
bitField.description: End Of Interrupt.

register.name: ICH_VMCR
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Virtual Machine Control Register
register.description: Enables the hypervisor to save and restore the virtual machine view of the GIC state.

bitField.name: VPMR
bitField.description: Virtual Priority Mask. The priority mask level for the virtual CPU interface. If the priority of a pending virtual interrupt is higher than the value indicated by this field, the interface signals the virtual interrupt to the PE.

bitField.name: VBPR0
bitField.description: Virtual Binary Point Register, Group 0. Defines the point at which the priority value fields split into two parts, the group priority field and the subpriority field. The group priority field determines Group 0 interrupt preemption, and also determines Group 1 interrupt preemption if ICH_VMCR.VCBPR == 1.

bitField.name: VBPR1
bitField.description: Virtual Binary Point Register, Group 1. Defines the point at which the priority value fields split into two parts, the group priority field and the subpriority field. The group priority field determines Group 1 interrupt preemption if ICH_VMCR.VCBPR == 0.

bitField.name: VEOIM
bitField.description: Virtual EOI mode.

bitField.name: VCBPR
bitField.description: Virtual Common Binary Point Register.

bitField.name: VFIQEn
bitField.description: Virtual FIQ enable.

bitField.name: VAckCtl
bitField.description: Virtual AckCtl.

bitField.name: VENG1
bitField.description: Virtual Group 1 interrupt enable.

bitField.name: VENG0
bitField.description: Virtual Group 0 interrupt enable.

register.name: ICH_VTR
register.description: Reports supported GIC virtualisartion features.

bitField.name: PRIbits
bitField.description: Priority bits. The number of virtual priority bits implemented, minus one.

bitField.name: PREbits
bitField.description: The number of virtual preemption bits implemented, minus one.

bitField.name: IDbits
bitField.description: The number of virtual interrupt identifier bits supported:

bitField.name: SEIS
bitField.description: SEI Support.

bitField.name: A3V
bitField.description: Affinity 3 Valid.

bitField.name: nV4
bitField.description: Direct injection of virtual interrupts not supported.

bitField.name: TDS
bitField.description: Separate trapping of Non-secure EL1 writes to ICV_DIR supported.

bitField.name: ListRegs
bitField.description: The number of implemented List registers, minus one. For example, a value of 0b01111 indicates that the maximum of 16 List registers are implemented.

register.name: ICV_AP0R0
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Virtual Active Priorities Group 0 Registers
register.description: Provides information about virtual Group 0 active priorities.

register.name: ICV_AP0R1
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Virtual Active Priorities Group 0 Registers
register.description: Provides information about virtual Group 0 active priorities.

register.name: ICV_AP0R2
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Virtual Active Priorities Group 0 Registers
register.description: Provides information about virtual Group 0 active priorities.

register.name: ICV_AP0R3
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Virtual Active Priorities Group 0 Registers
register.description: Provides information about virtual Group 0 active priorities.

register.name: ICV_AP1R0
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Virtual Active Priorities Group 1 Registers
register.description: Provides information about virtual Group 1 active priorities.

register.name: ICV_AP1R1
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Virtual Active Priorities Group 1 Registers
register.description: Provides information about virtual Group 1 active priorities.

register.name: ICV_AP1R2
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Virtual Active Priorities Group 1 Registers
register.description: Provides information about virtual Group 1 active priorities.

register.name: ICV_AP1R3
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Virtual Active Priorities Group 1 Registers
register.description: Provides information about virtual Group 1 active priorities.

register.name: ICV_BPR0
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Virtual Binary Point Register 0
register.description: Defines the point at which the priority value fields split into two parts, the group priority field and the subpriority field. The group priority field determines virtual Group 0 interrupt preemption.

bitField.name: BinaryPoint
bitField.description: The value of this field controls how the 8-bit interrupt priority field is split into a group priority field, that determines interrupt preemption, and a subpriority field.

register.name: ICV_BPR1
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Virtual Binary Point Register 1
register.description: Defines the point at which the priority value fields split into two parts, the group priority field and the subpriority field. The group priority field determines virtual Group 1 interrupt preemption.

bitField.name: BinaryPoint
bitField.description: If the GIC is configured to use separate binary point fields for virtual Group 0 and virtual Group 1 interrupts, the value of this field controls how the 8-bit interrupt priority field is split into a group priority field, that determines interrupt preemption, and a subpriority field.

register.name: ICV_CTLR
register.description: Controls aspects of the behavior of the GIC virtual CPU interface and provides information about the features implemented.

bitField.name: A3V
bitField.description: Affinity 3 Valid. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: SEIS
bitField.description: SEI Support. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: IDbits
bitField.description: Identifier bits. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: PRIbits
bitField.description: Priority bits. Read-only and writes are ignored. The number of priority bits implemented, minus one.

bitField.name: EOImode
bitField.description: Virtual EOI mode.

bitField.name: CBPR
bitField.description: Common Binary Point Register.

register.name: ICV_DIR
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Deactivate Virtual Interrupt Register
register.description: When interrupt priority drop is separated from interrupt deactivation, a write to this register deactivates the specified virtual interrupt.

bitField.name: INTID
bitField.description: The INTID of the virtual interrupt to be deactivated.

register.name: ICV_EOIR0
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Virtual End Of Interrupt Register 0
register.description: A PE writes to this register to inform the CPU interface that it has completed the processing of the specified virtual Group 0 interrupt.

bitField.name: INTID
bitField.description: The INTID from the corresponding ICV_IAR0 access.

register.name: ICV_EOIR1
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Virtual End Of Interrupt Register 1
register.description: A PE writes to this register to inform the CPU interface that it has completed the processing of the specified virtual Group 1 interrupt.

bitField.name: INTID
bitField.description: The INTID from the corresponding ICV_IAR1 access.

register.name: ICV_HPPIR0
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Virtual Highest Priority Pending Interrupt Register 0
register.description: Indicates the highest priority pending virtual Group 0 interrupt on the virtual CPU interface.

bitField.name: INTID
bitField.description: The INTID of the highest priority pending virtual interrupt.

register.name: ICV_HPPIR1
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Virtual Highest Priority Pending Interrupt Register 1
register.description: Indicates the highest priority pending virtual Group 1 interrupt on the virtual CPU interface.

bitField.name: INTID
bitField.description: The INTID of the highest priority pending virtual interrupt.

register.name: ICV_IGRPEN0
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Virtual Interrupt Group 0 Enable register
register.description: Controls whether virtual Group 0 interrupts are enabled or not.

bitField.name: Enable
bitField.description: Enables virtual Group 0 interrupts.

register.name: ICV_IGRPEN1
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Virtual Interrupt Group 1 Enable register
register.description: Controls whether virtual Group 1 interrupts are enabled for the current Security state.

bitField.name: Enable
bitField.description: Enables virtual Group 1 interrupts.

register.name: ICV_PMR
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Virtual Interrupt Priority Mask Register
register.description: Provides a virtual interrupt priority filter. Only virtual interrupts with a higher priority than the value in this register are signaled to the PE.

bitField.name: Priority
bitField.description: The priority mask level for the virtual CPU interface. If the priority of a virtual interrupt is higher than the value indicated by this field, the interface signals the virtual interrupt to the PE.

register.name: ICV_RPR
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Virtual Running Priority Register
register.description: Indicates the Running priority of the virtual CPU interface.

bitField.name: Priority
bitField.description: The current running priority on the virtual CPU interface. This is the group priority of the current active virtual interrupt.

register.name: AIDR
register.description: Provides IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED identification information...

register.name: CCSIDR
register.description: Provides information about the architecture of the currently selected cache.

bitField.name: UNKNOWN
bitField.description: Reserved, UNKNOWN.

bitField.name: NumSets
bitField.description: (Number of sets in cache) - 1, therefore a value of 0 indicates 1 set in the cache. The number of sets does not have to be a power of 2.

bitField.name: Associativity
bitField.description: (Associativity of cache) - 1, therefore a value of 0 indicates an associativity of 1. The associativity does not have to be a power of 2.

bitField.name: LineSize
bitField.description: (Log2(Number of bytes in cache line)) - 4.

register.name: CLIDR
register.description: Identifies the type of cache, or caches, that are implemented at each level and can be managed using the architected cache maintenance instructions that operate by set/way, up to a maximum of seven levels. Also identifies the Level of Coherence (LoC) and Level of Unification (LoU) for the cache hierarchy.

bitField.name: ICB
bitField.description: Inner cache boundary. This field indicates the boundary for caching Inner Cacheable memory regions.

bitField.name: LoUU
bitField.description: Level of Unification Uniprocessor for the cache hierarchy.

bitField.name: LoC
bitField.description: Level of Coherence for the cache hierarchy.

bitField.name: LoUIS
bitField.description: Level of Unification Inner Shareable for the cache hierarchy.

bitField.name: Ctype7
bitField.description: Cache Type fields. Indicate the type of cache that is implemented and can be managed using the architected cache maintenance instructions that operate by set/way at each level, from Level 1 up to a maximum of seven levels of cache hierarchy.

bitField.name: Ctype6
bitField.description: Cache Type fields. Indicate the type of cache that is implemented and can be managed using the architected cache maintenance instructions that operate by set/way at each level, from Level 1 up to a maximum of seven levels of cache hierarchy.

bitField.name: Ctype5
bitField.description: Cache Type fields. Indicate the type of cache that is implemented and can be managed using the architected cache maintenance instructions that operate by set/way at each level, from Level 1 up to a maximum of seven levels of cache hierarchy.

bitField.name: Ctype4
bitField.description: Cache Type fields. Indicate the type of cache that is implemented and can be managed using the architected cache maintenance instructions that operate by set/way at each level, from Level 1 up to a maximum of seven levels of cache hierarchy.

bitField.name: Ctype3
bitField.description: Cache Type fields. Indicate the type of cache that is implemented and can be managed using the architected cache maintenance instructions that operate by set/way at each level, from Level 1 up to a maximum of seven levels of cache hierarchy.

bitField.name: Ctype2
bitField.description: Cache Type fields. Indicate the type of cache that is implemented and can be managed using the architected cache maintenance instructions that operate by set/way at each level, from Level 1 up to a maximum of seven levels of cache hierarchy.

bitField.name: Ctype1
bitField.description: Cache Type fields. Indicate the type of cache that is implemented and can be managed using the architected cache maintenance instructions that operate by set/way at each level, from Level 1 up to a maximum of seven levels of cache hierarchy.

register.name: CSSELR
register.description: Selects the current Cache Size ID Register, CCSIDR, by specifying the required cache level and the cache type (either instruction or data cache).

bitField.name: Level
bitField.description: Cache level of required cache.

bitField.name: InD
bitField.description: Instruction not Data bit.

register.name: S_CSSELR
register.description: Selects the current Cache Size ID Register, CCSIDR, by specifying the required cache level and the cache type (either instruction or data cache).

bitField.name: Level
bitField.description: Cache level of required cache.

bitField.name: InD
bitField.description: Instruction not Data bit.

register.name: N_CSSELR
register.description: Selects the current Cache Size ID Register, CCSIDR, by specifying the required cache level and the cache type (either instruction or data cache).

bitField.name: Level
bitField.description: Cache level of required cache.

bitField.name: InD
bitField.description: Instruction not Data bit.

register.name: CTR
register.description: Provides information about the architecture of the caches.

bitField.name: CWG
bitField.description: Cache writeback granule. Log2 of the number of words of the maximum size of memory that can be overwritten as a result of the eviction of a cache entry that has had a memory location in it modified.

bitField.name: ERG
bitField.description: Exclusives reservation granule. Log2 of the number of words of the maximum size of the reservation granule that has been implemented for the Load-Exclusive and Store-Exclusive instructions.

bitField.name: DminLine
bitField.description: Log2 of the number of words in the smallest cache line of all the data caches and unified caches that are controlled by the PE.

bitField.name: L1Ip
bitField.description: Level 1 instruction cache policy. Indicates the indexing and tagging policy for the L1 instruction cache.

bitField.name: IminLine
bitField.description: Log2 of the number of words in the smallest cache line of all the instruction caches that are controlled by the PE.

register.name: FPSID
register.description: Provides top-level information about the floating-point implementation...

bitField.name: Implementer
bitField.description: Implementer codes are the same as those used for the MIDR.

bitField.name: SW
bitField.description: Software bit.

bitField.name: Subarchitecture
bitField.description: Subarchitecture version number.

bitField.name: PartNum
bitField.description: An IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED part number for the floating-point implementation, assigned by the implementer.

bitField.name: Variant
bitField.description: An IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED variant number. Typically, this field distinguishes between different production variants of a single product.

bitField.name: Revision
bitField.description: An IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED revision number for the floating-point implementation.

register.name: ID_AFR0
register.description: Provides information about the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED features of the PE in AArch32 state...

register.name: ID_DFR0
register.description: Provides top level information about the debug system in AArch32 state...

bitField.name: PerfMon
bitField.description: Performance Monitors. Support for System registers-based ARM Performance Monitors Extension, using registers in the coproc == 1111 encoding space, for A and R profile processors.

bitField.name: MProfDbg
bitField.description: M Profile Debug. Support for memory-mapped debug model for M profile processors.

bitField.name: MMapTrc
bitField.description: Memory Mapped Trace. Support for memory-mapped trace model.

bitField.name: CopTrc
bitField.description: Support for System registers-based trace model, using registers in the coproc == 1110 encoding space.

bitField.name: MMapDbg
bitField.description: Memory Mapped Debug. Support for v7 memory-mapped debug model, for A and R profile processors.

bitField.name: CopSDbg
bitField.description: Support for a System registers-based Secure debug model, using registers in the coproc = 1110 encoding space, for an A profile processor that includes EL3.

bitField.name: CopDbg
bitField.description: Support for System registers-based debug model, using registers in the coproc == 1110 encoding space, for A and R profile processors.

register.name: ID_ISAR0
register.description: Provides information about the instruction sets implemented by the PE in AArch32 state...

bitField.name: Divide
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented Divide instructions.

bitField.name: Debug
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented Debug instructions.

bitField.name: Coproc
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented System register access instructions.

bitField.name: CmpBranch
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented combined Compare and Branch instructions in the T32 instruction set.

bitField.name: BitField
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented BitField instructions.

bitField.name: BitCount
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented Bit Counting instructions.

bitField.name: Swap
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented Swap instructions in the A32 instruction set.

register.name: ID_ISAR1
register.description: Provides information about the instruction sets implemented by the PE in AArch32 state...

bitField.name: Jazelle
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented Jazelle extension instructions.

bitField.name: Interwork
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented Interworking instructions.

bitField.name: Immediate
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented data-processing instructions with long immediates.

bitField.name: IfThen
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented If-Then instructions in the T32 instruction set.

bitField.name: Extend
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented Extend instructions.

bitField.name: Except_AR
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented A and R profile exception-handling instructions.

bitField.name: Except
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented exception-handling instructions in the ARM instruction set.

bitField.name: Endian
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented Endian instructions.

register.name: ID_ISAR2
register.description: Provides information about the instruction sets implemented by the PE in AArch32 state...

bitField.name: Reversal
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented Reversal instructions.

bitField.name: PSR_AR
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented A and R profile instructions to manipulate the PSR.

bitField.name: MultU
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented advanced unsigned Multiply instructions.

bitField.name: MultS
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented advanced signed Multiply instructions.

bitField.name: Mult
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented additional Multiply instructions.

bitField.name: MultiAccessInt
bitField.description: Indicates the support for interruptible multi-access instructions.

bitField.name: MemHint
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented Memory Hint instructions.

bitField.name: LoadStore
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented additional load/store instructions.

register.name: ID_ISAR3
register.description: Provides information about the instruction sets implemented by the PE in AArch32 state...

bitField.name: T32EE
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented T32EE instructions.

bitField.name: TrueNOP
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented true NOP instructions.

bitField.name: T32Copy
bitField.description: Indicates the support for T32 non flag-setting MOV instructions.

bitField.name: TabBranch
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented Table Branch instructions in the T32 instruction set.

bitField.name: SynchPrim
bitField.description: Used in conjunction with ID_ISAR4.SynchPrim_frac to indicate the implemented Synchronization Primitive instructions.

bitField.name: SVC
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented SVC instructions.

bitField.name: SIMD
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented SIMD instructions.

bitField.name: Saturate
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented Saturate instructions.

register.name: ID_ISAR4
register.description: Provides information about the instruction sets implemented by the PE in AArch32 state...

bitField.name: SWP_frac
bitField.description: Indicates support for the memory system locking the bus for SWP or SWPB instructions.

bitField.name: PSR_M
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented M profile instructions to modify the PSRs.

bitField.name: SynchPrim_frac
bitField.description: Used in conjunction with ID_ISAR3.SynchPrim to indicate the implemented Synchronization Primitive instructions.

bitField.name: Barrier
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented Barrier instructions in the A32 and T32 instruction sets.

bitField.name: SMC
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented SMC instructions.

bitField.name: Writeback
bitField.description: Indicates the support for Writeback addressing modes.

bitField.name: WithShifts
bitField.description: Indicates the support for instructions with shifts.

bitField.name: Unpriv
bitField.description: Indicates the implemented unprivileged instructions.

register.name: ID_ISAR5
register.description: Provides information about the instruction sets implemented by the PE in AArch32 state...

bitField.name: CRC32
bitField.description: Indicates whether the CRC32 instructions are implemented in AArch32 state.

bitField.name: SHA2
bitField.description: Indicates whether the SHA2 instructions are implemented in AArch32 state.

bitField.name: SHA1
bitField.description: Indicates whether the SHA1 instructions are implemented in AArch32 state.

bitField.name: AES
bitField.description: Indicates whether the AES instructions are implemented in AArch32 state.

bitField.name: SEVL
bitField.description: Indicates whether the SEVL instruction is implemented in AArch32 state.

register.name: ID_MMFR0
register.description: Provides information about the implemented memory model and memory management support in AArch32 state...

bitField.name: InnerShr
bitField.description: Innermost Shareability. Indicates the innermost shareability domain implemented.

bitField.name: FCSE
bitField.description: Indicates whether the implementation includes the FCSE.

bitField.name: AuxReg
bitField.description: Auxiliary Registers. Indicates support for Auxiliary registers.

bitField.name: TCM
bitField.description: Indicates support for TCMs and associated DMAs.

bitField.name: ShareLvl
bitField.description: Shareability Levels. Indicates the number of shareability levels implemented.

bitField.name: OuterShr
bitField.description: Outermost Shareability. Indicates the outermost shareability domain implemented.

bitField.name: PMSA
bitField.description: Indicates support for a PMSA.

bitField.name: VMSA
bitField.description: Indicates support for a VMSA.

register.name: ID_MMFR1
register.description: Provides information about the implemented memory model and memory management support in AArch32 state...

bitField.name: BPred
bitField.description: Branch Predictor. Indicates branch predictor management requirements.

bitField.name: L1TstCln
bitField.description: Level 1 cache Test and Clean. Indicates the supported Level 1 data cache test and clean operations, for Harvard or unified cache implementations.

bitField.name: L1Uni
bitField.description: Level 1 Unified cache. Indicates the supported entire Level 1 cache maintenance operations for a unified cache implementation.

bitField.name: L1Hvd
bitField.description: Level 1 Harvard cache. Indicates the supported entire Level 1 cache maintenance operations for a Harvard cache implementation.

bitField.name: L1UniSW
bitField.description: Level 1 Unified cache by Set/Way. Indicates the supported Level 1 cache line maintenance operations by set/way, for a unified cache implementation.

bitField.name: L1HvdSW
bitField.description: Level 1 Harvard cache by Set/Way. Indicates the supported Level 1 cache line maintenance operations by set/way, for a Harvard cache implementation.

bitField.name: L1UniVA
bitField.description: Level 1 Unified cache by Virtual Address. Indicates the supported Level 1 cache line maintenance operations by VA, for a unified cache implementation.

bitField.name: L1HvdVA
bitField.description: Level 1 Harvard cache by Virtual Address. Indicates the supported Level 1 cache line maintenance operations by VA, for a Harvard cache implementation.

register.name: ID_MMFR2
register.description: Provides information about the implemented memory model and memory management support in AArch32 state...

bitField.name: HWAccFlg
bitField.description: Hardware Access Flag. In earlier versions of the ARM Architecture, this field indicates support for a Hardware Access flag, as part of the VMSAv7 implementation.

bitField.name: WFIStall
bitField.description: Wait For Interrupt Stall. Indicates the support for Wait For Interrupt (WFI) stalling.

bitField.name: MemBarr
bitField.description: Memory Barrier.

bitField.name: UniTLB
bitField.description: Unified TLB. Indicates the supported TLB maintenance operations, for a unified TLB implementation.

bitField.name: HvdTLB
bitField.description: If the Unified TLB field (UniTLB, bits [19:16]) is not 0000, then the meaning of this field is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED. ARM deprecates the use of this field by software.

bitField.name: L1HvdRng
bitField.description: Level 1 Harvard cache Range. Indicates the supported Level 1 cache maintenance range operations, for a Harvard cache implementation.

bitField.name: L1HvdBG
bitField.description: Level 1 Harvard cache Background fetch. Indicates the supported Level 1 cache background fetch operations, for a Harvard cache implementation. When supported, background fetch operations are non-blocking operations.

bitField.name: L1HvdFG
bitField.description: Level 1 Harvard cache Foreground fetch. Indicates the supported Level 1 cache foreground fetch operations, for a Harvard cache implementation. When supported, foreground fetch operations are blocking operations.

register.name: ID_MMFR3
register.description: Provides information about the implemented memory model and memory management support in AArch32 state...

bitField.name: Supersec
bitField.description: Supersections. On a VMSA implementation, indicates whether Supersections are supported.

bitField.name: CMemSz
bitField.description: Cached Memory Size. Indicates the physical memory size supported by the caches.

bitField.name: CohWalk
bitField.description: Coherent Walk. Indicates whether Translation table updates require a clean to the point of unification.

bitField.name: MaintBcst
bitField.description: Maintenance Broadcast. Indicates whether Cache, TLB, and branch predictor operations are broadcast.

bitField.name: BPMaint
bitField.description: Branch Predictor Maintenance. Indicates the supported branch predictor maintenance operations in an implementation with hierarchical cache maintenance operations.

bitField.name: CMaintSW
bitField.description: Cache Maintenance by Set/Way. Indicates the supported cache maintenance operations by set/way, in an implementation with hierarchical caches.

bitField.name: CMaintVA
bitField.description: Cache Maintenance by Virtual Address. Indicates the supported cache maintenance operations by VA, in an implementation with hierarchical caches.

register.name: ID_MMFR4
register.description: Provides information about the implemented memory model and memory management support in AArch32 state...

bitField.name: AC2
bitField.description: Indicates the extension of the ACTLR and HACTLR registers using ACTLR2 and HACTLR2.

bitField.name: SpecSEI
bitField.description: Describes whether the PE can generate SError interrupt exceptions from speculative reads of memory, including speculative instruction fetches.

register.name: ID_PFR0
register.description: Gives top-level information about the instruction sets supported by the PE in AArch32 state...

bitField.name: RAS
bitField.description: RAS Extension version.

bitField.name: State3
bitField.description: T32EE instruction set support.

bitField.name: State2
bitField.description: Jazelle extension support.

bitField.name: State1
bitField.description: T32 instruction set support.

bitField.name: State0
bitField.description: A32 instruction set support.

register.name: ID_PFR1
register.description: Gives information about the AArch32 programmers' model...

bitField.name: GIC
bitField.description: System register GIC CPU interface.

bitField.name: Virt_frac
bitField.description: Virtualization fractional field. When the Virtualization field is 0000, determines the support for features from the ARMv7 Virtualization Extensions.

bitField.name: Sec_frac
bitField.description: Security fractional field. When the Security field is 0000, determines the support for features from the ARMv7 Security Extensions.

bitField.name: GenTimer
bitField.description: Generic Timer support.

bitField.name: Virtualization
bitField.description: Virtualization support.

bitField.name: MProgMod
bitField.description: M profile programmers' model support.

bitField.name: Security
bitField.description: Security support.

bitField.name: ProgMod
bitField.description: Support for the standard programmers' model for ARMv4 and later. Model must support User, FIQ, IRQ, Supervisor, Abort, Undefined, and System modes.

register.name: MIDR
register.description: Provides identification information for the PE, including an implementer code for the device and a device ID number.

bitField.name: Implementer
bitField.description: The Implementer code. This field must hold an implementer code that has been assigned by ARM.

bitField.name: Variant
bitField.description: An IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED variant number. Typically, this field is used to distinguish between different product variants, or major revisions of a product.

bitField.name: Architecture
bitField.description: The permitted values of this field are:

bitField.name: PartNum
bitField.description: An IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED primary part number for the device.

bitField.name: Revision
bitField.description: An IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED revision number for the device.

register.name: MPIDR
register.description: In a multiprocessor system, provides an additional PE identification mechanism for scheduling purposes.

bitField.name: M
bitField.description: Indicates whether this implementation includes the functionality introduced by the ARMv7 Multiprocessing Extensions.

bitField.name: U
bitField.description: Indicates a Uniprocessor system, as distinct from PE 0 in a multiprocessor system.

bitField.name: MT
bitField.description: Indicates whether the lowest level of affinity consists of logical PEs that are implemented using a multithreading type approach.

bitField.name: Aff2
bitField.description: Affinity level 2. The least significant affinity level field, for this PE in the system.

bitField.name: Aff1
bitField.description: Affinity level 1. The intermediate affinity level field, for this PE in the system.

bitField.name: Aff0
bitField.description: Affinity level 0. The most significant affinity level field, for this PE in the system.

register.name: MVFR0
register.description: Describes the features provided by the AArch32 Advanced SIMD and Floating-point implementation...

bitField.name: FPRound
bitField.description: Floating-Point Rounding modes. Indicates whether the floating-point implementation provides support for rounding modes.

bitField.name: FPShVec
bitField.description: Short Vectors. Indicates whether the floating-point implementation provides support for the use of short vectors.

bitField.name: FPSqrt
bitField.description: Square Root. Indicates whether the floating-point implementation provides support for the ARMv6 VFP square root operations.

bitField.name: FPDivide
bitField.description: Indicates whether the floating-point implementation provides support for VFP divide operations.

bitField.name: FPTrap
bitField.description: Floating Point Exception Trapping. Indicates whether the floating-point implementation provides support for exception trapping.

bitField.name: FPDP
bitField.description: Double Precision. Indicates whether the floating-point implementation provides support for double-precision operations.

bitField.name: FPSP
bitField.description: Single Precision. Indicates whether the floating-point implementation provides support for single-precision operations.

bitField.name: SIMDReg
bitField.description: Advanced SIMD registers. Indicates whether the Advanced SIMD and floating-point implementation provides support for the Advanced SIMD and floating-point register bank.

register.name: MVFR1
register.description: Describes the features provided by the AArch32 Advanced SIMD and Floating-point implementation...

bitField.name: SIMDFMAC
bitField.description: Advanced SIMD Fused Multiply-Accumulate. Indicates whether the Advanced SIMD implementation provides fused multiply accumulate instructions.

bitField.name: FPHP
bitField.description: Floating Point Half Precision. Indicates whether the floating-point implementation provides half-precision floating-point conversion instructions.

bitField.name: SIMDHP
bitField.description: Advanced SIMD Half Precision. Indicates whether the Advanced SIMD and floating-point implementation provides half-precision floating-point conversion instructions.

bitField.name: SIMDSP
bitField.description: Advanced SIMD Single Precision. Indicates whether the Advanced SIMD and floating-point implementation provides single-precision floating-point instructions.

bitField.name: SIMDInt
bitField.description: Advanced SIMD Integer. Indicates whether the Advanced SIMD and floating-point implementation provides integer instructions.

bitField.name: SIMDLS
bitField.description: Advanced SIMD Load/Store. Indicates whether the Advanced SIMD and floating-point implementation provides load/store instructions.

bitField.name: FPDNaN
bitField.description: Default NaN mode. Indicates whether the floating-point implementation provides support only for the Default NaN mode.

bitField.name: FPFtZ
bitField.description: Flush to Zero mode. Indicates whether the floating-point implementation provides support only for the Flush-to-Zero mode of operation.

register.name: MVFR2
register.description: Describes the features provided by the AArch32 Advanced SIMD and Floating-point implementation...

bitField.name: FPMisc
bitField.description: Indicates whether the floating-point implementation provides support for miscellaneous VFP features.

bitField.name: SIMDMisc
bitField.description: Indicates whether the Advanced SIMD implementation provides support for miscellaneous Advanced SIMD features.

register.name: REVIDR
register.description: Provides implementation-specific minor revision information.

register.name: TCMTR
register.description: Provides information about the implementation of the TCM.

register.name: TLBTR
register.description: Provides information about the TLB implementation. The register must define whether the implementation provides separate instruction and data TLBs, or a unified TLB. Normally, the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED information in this register includes the number of lockable entries in the TLB.

bitField.name: nU
bitField.description: Not Unified TLB.

register.name: VMPIDR
register.description: Holds the value of the Virtualization Multiprocessor ID. This is the value returned by Non-secure EL1 reads of MPIDR.

bitField.name: M
bitField.description: Indicates whether this implementation includes the functionality introduced by the ARMv7 Multiprocessing Extensions.

bitField.name: U
bitField.description: Indicates a Uniprocessor system, as distinct from PE 0 in a multiprocessor system.

bitField.name: MT
bitField.description: Indicates whether the lowest level of affinity consists of logical PEs that are implemented using a multithreading type approach.

bitField.name: Aff2
bitField.description: Affinity level 2. The least significant affinity level field, for this PE in the system.

bitField.name: Aff1
bitField.description: Affinity level 1. The intermediate affinity level field, for this PE in the system.

bitField.name: Aff0
bitField.description: Affinity level 0. The most significant affinity level field, for this PE in the system.

register.name: VPIDR
register.description: Holds the value of the Virtualization Processor ID. This is the value returned by Non-secure EL1 reads of MIDR.

bitField.name: Implementer
bitField.description: The Implementer code. This field must hold an implementer code that has been assigned by ARM.

bitField.name: Variant
bitField.description: An IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED variant number. Typically, this field is used to distinguish between different product variants, or major revisions of a product.

bitField.name: Architecture
bitField.description: The permitted values of this field are:

bitField.name: PartNum
bitField.description: An IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED primary part number for the device.

bitField.name: Revision
bitField.description: An IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED revision number for the device.

register.name: HAMAIR0
register.gui_name: Hyp Auxiliary Memory Attribute Indirection Register 0
register.description: Provides IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED memory attributes for the memory attribute encodings defined by HMAIR0. These IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED attributes can only provide additional qualifiers for the memory attribute encodings, and cannot change the memory attributes defined in HMAIR0.

register.name: HAMAIR1
register.gui_name: Hyp Auxiliary Memory Attribute Indirection Register 1
register.description: Provides IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED memory attributes for the memory attribute encodings defined by HMAIR1. bitField.description: Inner cacheability attribute for memory associated with translation table walks using HTTBR.

bitField.name: T0SZ
bitField.description: The size offset of the memory region addressed by HTTBR. The region size is 2^(32-T0SZ) bytes.

register.name: HTTBR
register.description: Holds the base address of the translation table for the initial lookup for stage 1 of an address translation in the EL2 translation regime, and other information for this translation regime.

bitField.name: BADDR
bitField.description: Translation table base address, bits[47:x], Bits [x-1:0] are RES0, with the additional requirement that if bits[x-1:3] are not all zero, this is a misaligned translation table base address, with effects that are CONSTRAINED UNPREDICTABLE, and must be one of the following:

register.name: MAIR0
register.description: Along with MAIR1, provides the memory attribute encodings corresponding to the possible AttrIndx values in a Long-descriptor format translation table entry for stage 1 translations...

register.name: PRRR
register.description: Controls the top level mapping of the TEX[0], C, and B memory region attributes.

bitField.name: NOS7
bitField.description: Not Outer Shareable. NOS<n> is the Outer Shareable property for memory attributes n, if the region is mapped as Normal memory that is not Inner Non-cacheable, Outer Non-cacheable, and the appropriate PRRR.{NS0, NS1} field identifies the region as shareable. n is the value of the concatenation of the {TEX[0], C, B} bits from the translation table descriptor.

bitField.name: NOS6
bitField.description: Not Outer Shareable. NOS<n> is the Outer Shareable property for memory attributes n, if the region is mapped as Normal memory that is not Inner Non-cacheable, Outer Non-cacheable, and the appropriate PRRR.{NS0, NS1} field identifies the region as shareable. n is the value of the concatenation of the {TEX[0], C, B} bits from the translation table descriptor.

bitField.name: NS1
bitField.description: Mapping of S = 1 attribute for Normal memory regions.

bitField.name: NS0
bitField.description: Mapping of S = 0 attribute for Normal memory regions.

bitField.name: DS1
bitField.description: Mapping of S = 1 attribute for Device memory. In ARMv8, all types of Device memory are Outer Shareable, and therefore this bit is RES1.

bitField.name: DS0
bitField.description: Mapping of S = 0 attribute for Device memory. In ARMv8, all types of Device memory are Outer Shareable, and therefore this bit is RES1.

bitField.name: TR7
bitField.description: TR<n> is the primary TEX mapping for memory attributes n, and defines the mapped memory type for a region with attributes n. n is the value of the concatenation of the {TEX[0], C, B} bits from the translation table descriptor.

NOS<n> is the Outer Shareable property for memory attributes n, if the region is mapped as Normal memory that is not Inner Non-cacheable, Outer Non-cacheable, and the appropriate PRRR.{NS0, NS1} field identifies the region as shareable. n is the value of the concatenation of the {TEX[0], C, B} bits from the translation table descriptor.

bitField.name: NOS6
bitField.description: Not Outer Shareable. NOS<n> is the Outer Shareable property for memory attributes n, if the region is mapped as Normal memory that is not Inner Non-cacheable, Outer Non-cacheable, and the appropriate PRRR.{NS0, NS1} field identifies the region as shareable. n is the value of the concatenation of the {TEX[0], C, B} bits from the translation table descriptor.

bitField.name: NOS1

bitField.name: NOS0
bitField.description: Not Outer Shareable. NOS<n> is the Outer Shareable property for memory attributes n, if the region is mapped as Normal memory that is not Inner Non-cacheable, Outer Non-cacheable, and the appropriate PRRR.{NS0, NS1} field identifies the region as shareable. n is the value of the concatenation of the {TEX[0], C, B} bits from the translation table descriptor.

bitField.name: NS1
bitField.description: Mapping of S = 1 attribute for Normal memory regions.

bitField.name: NS0
bitField.description: Mapping of S = 0 attribute for Normal memory regions.

bitField.name: DS1
bitField.description: Mapping of S = 1 attribute for Device memory. In ARMv8, all types of Device memory are Outer Shareable, and therefore this bit is RES1.

bitField.name: DS0
bitField.description: Mapping of S = 0 attribute for Device memory. In ARMv8, all types of Device memory are Outer Shareable, and therefore this bit is RES1.

bitField.name: TR7
bitField.description: TR<n> is the primary TEX mapping for memory attributes n, and defines the mapped memory type for a region with attributes n. n is the value of the concatenation of the {TEX[0], C, B} bits from the translation table descriptor.

register.name: TTBCR

bitField.name: EAE

register.name: TTBR0
register.description: Holds the base address of the translation table for the initial lookup for stage 1 of the translation of an address from the lower VA range in the PL1&0 translation regime, and other information for this translation regime.

bitField.name: TTB0
bitField.description: Translation table base address, bits[31:x], where x is 14-(TTBCR.N).

bitField.name: IRGN_0
bitField.description: See the IRGN[1] description.

bitField.name: NOS
bitField.description: Not Outer Shareable. When the value of TTBR0.

bitField.name: RGN
bitField.description: Region bits.

bitField.name: IMP
bitField.description: The effect of this bit is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED. If the translation table implementation does not include any IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED features this bit is UNK/SBZP.

bitField.name: S
bitField.description: Shareable.

bitField.name: IRGN_1
bitField.description: Inner region bits. IRGN[1:0] indicate the Inner Cacheability attributes for the memory associated with the translation table walks.

register.name: TTBR0_64
register.description: Holds the base address of the translation table for the initial lookup for stage 1 of the translation of an address from the lower VA range in the PL1&0 translation regime, and other information for this translation regime.

bitField.name: ASID
bitField.description: An ASID for the translation table base address. The TTBCR.A1 field selects either TTBR0.ASID or TTBR1.ASID.

bitField.name: BADDR
bitField.description: Translation table base address, bits[47:x], Bits [x-1:0] are RES0, with the additional requirement that if bits[x-1:3] are not all zero, this is a misaligned translation table base address, with effects that are CONSTRAINED UNPREDICTABLE, and must be one of the following:

register.name: VTCR
register.description: The control register for stage 2 of the Non-secure PL1&0 translation regime.

bitField.name: SH0
bitField.description: Shareability attribute for memory associated with translation table walks using VTTBR.

bitField.name: ORGN0
bitField.description: Outer cacheability attribute for memory associated with translation table walks using VTTBR.

bitField.name: IRGN0
bitField.description: Inner cacheability attribute for memory associated with translation table walks using VTTBR.

bitField.name: SL0
bitField.description: Starting level for translation table walks using VTTBR.

bitField.name: S
bitField.description: Sign extension bit. This bit must be programmed to the value of T0SZ[3]. If it is not, then the behavior is CONSTRAINED UNPREDICTABLE and the stage 2 T0SZ value is treated as an UNKNOWN value, see .

bitField.name: T0SZ
bitField.description: The size offset of the memory region addressed by VTTBR. The region size is 2^(32-T0SZ) bytes.

register.name: VTTBR
register.description: Holds the base address of the translation table for the initial lookup for stage 2 of an address translation in the Non-secure PL1&0 translation regime, and other information for this translation regime.

bitField.name: VMID
bitField.description: The VMID for the translation table.

bitField.name: BADDR
bitField.description: Translation table base address, bits[47:x], Bits [x-1:0] are RES0, with the additional requirement that if bits[x-1:3] are not all zero, this is a misaligned translation table base address, with effects that are CONSTRAINED UNPREDICTABLE, and must be one of the following:

register.name: ACTLR
register.description: Provides IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED configuration and control options for execution at EL1 and EL0.

register.name: S_ACTLR
register.description: Provides IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED configuration and control options for execution at EL1 and EL0.

register.name: N_ACTLR
register.description: Provides IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED configuration and control options for execution at EL1 and EL0.

register.name: ACTLR2
register.description: Provides additional space to the ACTLR register to hold IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED trap functionality for execution at EL1 and EL0.

register.name: S_ACTLR2
register.description: Provides additional space to the ACTLR register to hold IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED trap functionality for execution at EL1 and EL0.

register.name: N_ACTLR2
register.description: Provides additional space to the ACTLR register to hold IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED trap functionality for execution at EL1 and EL0.

register.name: CPACR
register.description: Controls access to trace, and to Advanced SIMD and floating-point functionality from EL0, EL1, and EL3...

bitField.name: ASEDIS
bitField.description: Disables PL0 and PL1 execution of Advanced SIMD instructions.

bitField.name: TRCDIS
bitField.description: Traps PL0 and PL1 System register accesses to all implemented trace registers to Undefined mode.

bitField.name: cp11
bitField.description: The value of this field is ignored. If this field is programmed with a different value to the cp10 field then this field is UNKNOWN on a direct read of the CPACR.

bitField.name: cp10
bitField.description: Defines the access rights for the floating-point and Advanced SIMD functionality.

register.name: HACTLR
register.description: Controls IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED features of Hyp mode operation.

register.name: HACTLR2
register.description: Provides additional space to the HACTLR register to hold IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED trap functionality.

register.name: HSCTLR
register.description: Provides top level control of the system operation in Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TE
bitField.description: T32 Exception Enable.

bitField.name: EE
bitField.description: The value of the PSTATE.E bit on entry to Hyp mode, the endianness of stage 1 translation table walks in the EL2 translation regime, and the endianness of stage 2 translation table walks in the PL1&0 translation regime.

bitField.name: WXN
bitField.description: Write permission implies XN (Execute-never). For the EL2 translation regime, this bit can force all memory regions that are writable to be treated as XN.

bitField.name: I
bitField.description: Instruction access Cacheability control, for accesses at EL2:

bitField.name: SED
bitField.description: SETEND instruction disable. Disables SETEND instructions at EL2.

bitField.name: ITD
bitField.description: IT Disable. Disables some uses of IT instructions at EL2.

bitField.name: CP15BEN
bitField.description: System instruction memory barrier enable.

bitField.name: C
bitField.description: Cacheability control, for data accesses at EL2:

bitField.name: A
bitField.description: Alignment check enable.

bitField.name: M
bitField.description: MMU enable for EL2 stage 1 address translation.

register.name: SCTLR
register.description: Provides the top level control of the system, including its memory system.

bitField.name: TE
bitField.description: T32 Exception Enable.

bitField.name: AFE
bitField.description: Access Flag Enable. When using the Short-descriptor translation table format for the PL1&0 translation regime, this bit enables use of the AP[0] bit in the translation descriptors as the Access flag, and restricts access permissions in the translation descriptors to the simplified model.

bitField.name: TRE
bitField.description: TEX remap enable. This bit enables remapping of the TEX[2:1] bits in the PL1&0 translation regime for use as two translation table bits that can be managed by the operating system. Enabling this remapping also changes the scheme used to describe the memory region attributes in the VMSA.

bitField.name: EE
bitField.description: The value of the PSTATE.E bit on branch to an exception vector or coming out of reset, and the endianness of stage 1 translation table walks in the PL1&0 translation regime.

bitField.name: UWXN
bitField.description: Unprivileged write permission implies PL1 XN (Execute-never). This bit can force all memory regions that are writable at PL0 to be treated as XN for accesses from software executing at PL1.

bitField.name: WXN
bitField.description: Write permission implies XN (Execute-never). For the PL1&0 translation regime, this bit can force all memory regions that are writable to be treated as XN.

bitField.name: nTWE
bitField.description: Traps EL0 execution of WFE instructions to Undefined mode.

bitField.name: nTWI
bitField.description: Traps EL0 execution of WFI instructions to Undefined mode.

bitField.name: V
bitField.description: Vectors bit.

bitField.name: I
bitField.description: Instruction access Cacheability control, for accesses at EL1 and EL0:

bitField.name: SED
bitField.description: SETEND instruction disable. Disables SETEND instructions at PL0 and PL1.

bitField.name: ITD
bitField.description: IT Disable. Disables some uses of IT instructions at PL1 and PL0.

bitField.name: UNK
bitField.description: Writes to this bit are IGNORED. Reads of this bit return an UNKNOWN value.

bitField.name: CP15BEN
bitField.description: System instruction memory barrier enable.

bitField.name: C
bitField.description: Cacheability control, for data accesses at EL1 and EL0:

bitField.name: A
bitField.description: Alignment check enable.

bitField.name: M
bitField.description: MMU enable for EL1 and EL0 stage 1 address translation.

register.name: PMCCFILTR
register.gui_name: Performance Monitors Cycle Count Filter Register
register.description: Determines the modes in which the Cycle Counter, PMCCNTR, increments.

bitField.name: P
bitField.description: Privileged filtering bit. Controls counting in EL1. If EL3 is implemented, then counting in Non-secure EL1 is further controlled by the NSK bit.

bitField.name: U
bitField.description: User filtering bit. Controls counting in EL0. If EL3 is implemented, then counting in Non-secure EL0 is further controlled by the NSU bit.

bitField.name: NSK
bitField.description: Non-secure EL1 (kernel) modes filtering bit. Controls counting in Non-secure EL1. If EL3 is not implemented, this bit is RES0.

bitField.name: NSU
bitField.description: Non-secure EL0 (Unprivileged) filtering. Controls counting in Non-secure EL0. If EL3 is not implemented, this bit is RES0.

bitField.name: NSH
bitField.description: Non-secure EL2 (Hyp mode) filtering bit. Controls counting in Non-secure EL2. If EL2 is not implemented, this bit is RES0.

register.name: PMCCNTR
register.description: Holds the value of the processor Cycle Counter, CCNT, that counts processor clock cycles. See for more information...

bitField.name: CCNT
bitField.description: Cycle count. Depending on the values of PMCR.

register.name: PMCCNTR_64
register.description: Holds the value of the processor Cycle Counter, CCNT, that counts processor clock cycles. See for more information...

bitField.name: CCNT
bitField.description: Cycle count. Depending on the values of PMCR.

register.name: PMCEID0
register.gui_name: Performance Monitors Common Event Identification register 0
register.description: Defines which common architectural and common microarchitectural feature events in the range 0x000 to 0x01F are implemented. If a particular bit is set to 1, then the event for that bit is implemented.

bitField.name: ID_31_0
bitField.description: PMCEID0[n] maps to event n. For a list of event numbers and descriptions, see .

register.name: PMCEID1
register.gui_name: Performance Monitors Common Event Identification register 1
register.description: Defines which common architectural and common microarchitectural feature events in the range 0x020 to 0x03F are implemented. If a particular bit is set to 1, then the event for that bit is implemented.

bitField.name: ID_63_32
bitField.description: PMCEID1[n] maps to event (n + 32). For a list of event numbers and descriptions, see .

register.name: PMCNTENCLR
register.gui_name: Performance Monitors Count Enable Clear register
register.description: Disables the Cycle Count Register, PMCCNTR, and any implemented event counters PMEVCNTR<n>. Reading this register shows which counters are enabled...

bitField.name: C
bitField.description: PMCCNTR disable bit. Disables the cycle counter register.

bitField.name: P30

register.name: PMCR
register.description: Provides details of the Performance Monitors implementation, including the number of counters implemented, and configures and controls the counters.

bitField.name: IMP
bitField.description: Implementer code. This field is RO with an IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED value.

bitField.name: IDCODE
bitField.description: Identification code. This field is RO with an IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED value.

bitField.name: N
bitField.description: Number of event counters. A RO field that indicates the number counters implemented. A value of 0b00000 in this field indicates that only the Cycle Count Register PMCCNTR is implemented.

bitField.name: LC
bitField.description: Long cycle counter enable. Determines which PMCCNTR bit generates an overflow recorded by PMOVSR[31].

bitField.name: DP
bitField.description: Disable cycle counter when event counting is prohibited.

bitField.name: X
bitField.description: Enable export of events in an IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED event stream.

bitField.name: D
bitField.description: Clock divider.

bitField.name: C
bitField.description: Cycle counter reset. This bit is WO.

bitField.name: P
bitField.description: Event counter reset. This bit is WO.

bitField.name: E
bitField.description: Enable.

register.name: PMEVTYPER0
register.description: Configures event counter n, where n is 0 to 30.

bitField.name: P
bitField.description: Privileged filtering bit. Controls counting in EL1. If EL3 is implemented, then counting in Non-secure EL1 is further controlled by the NSK bit.

bitField.name: U
bitField.description: User filtering bit. Controls counting in EL0. If EL3 is implemented, then counting in Non-secure EL0 is further controlled by the NSU bit.

bitField.name: NSK
bitField.description: Non-secure EL1 (kernel) modes filtering bit. Controls counting in Non-secure EL1. If EL3 is not implemented, this bit is RES0.

bitField.name: NSU
bitField.description: Non-secure EL0 (Unprivileged) filtering. Controls counting in Non-secure EL0. If EL3 is not implemented, this bit is RES0.

bitField.name: NSH
bitField.description: Non-secure EL2 (Hyp mode) filtering bit. Controls counting in Non-secure EL2. If EL2 is not implemented, this bit is RES0.

bitField.name: MT
bitField.description: Multithreading.

bitField.name: evtCount
bitField.description: Event to count. The event number of the event that is counted by event counter PMEVCNTR<n>.

register.description: Configures event counter n, where n is 0 to 30.

bitField.name: P
bitField.description: Privileged filtering bit. Controls counting in EL1. If EL3 is implemented, then counting in Non-secure EL1 is further controlled by the NSK bit.

bitField.name: U
bitField.description: User filtering bit. Controls counting in EL0. If EL3 is implemented, then counting in Non-secure EL0 is further controlled by the NSU bit.

bitField.name: NSK
bitField.description: Non-secure EL1 (kernel) modes filtering bit. Controls counting in Non-secure EL1. If EL3 is not implemented, this bit is RES0.

bitField.name: NSU
bitField.description: Non-secure EL0 (Unprivileged) filtering. Controls counting in Non-secure EL0. If EL3 is not implemented, this bit is RES0.

bitField.name: NSH
bitField.description: Non-secure EL2 (Hyp mode) filtering bit. Controls counting in Non-secure EL2. If EL2 is not implemented, this bit is RES0.

bitField.name: MT
bitField.description: Multithreading.

bitField.name: evtCount
bitField.description: Event to count. The event number of the event that is counted by event counter PMEVCNTR<n>.

register.name: PMINTENCLR
register.gui_name: Performance Monitors Interrupt Enable Clear register
register.description: Disables the generation of interrupt requests on overflows from the Cycle Count Register, PMCCNTR, and the event counters PMEVCNTR<n>. Reading the register shows which overflow interrupt requests are enabled...

bitField.name: C
bitField.description: PMCCNTR overflow interrupt request disable bit.

register.name: PMUSERENR
register.description: Enables or disables User mode access to the Performance Monitors.

bitField.name: ER
bitField.description: Event counter read trap control:

bitField.name: CR
bitField.description: Cycle counter read trap control:

bitField.name: SW
bitField.description: Software increment write trap control:

bitField.name: EN
bitField.description: Traps EL0 accesses to the Performance Monitors registers to Undefined mode:

register.name: PMXEVCNTR
register.gui_name: Performance Monitors Selected Event Count Register
register.description: Reads or writes the value of the selected event counter, PMEVCNTR<n>. PMSELR.SEL determines which event counter is selected.

bitField.name: PMEVCNTR_n
bitField.description: Value of the selected event counter, PMEVCNTR<n>, where n is the value stored in PMSELR.SEL.

register.name: PMXEVTYPER
register.gui_name: Performance Monitors Selected Event Type Register
register.description: When PMSELR.SEL selects an event counter, this accesses a PMEVTYPER<n> register. When PMSELR.SEL selects the cycle counter, this accesses PMCCFILTR.

register.name: HRMR
register.description: If EL2 is the highest implemented Exception level and this register is implemented...

bitField.name: RR
bitField.description: Reset Request. Setting this bit to 1 requests a Warm reset.

bitField.name: AA64
bitField.description: When EL2 can use AArch64, determines which Execution state the PE boots into after a Warm reset:

register.name: RMR
register.description: If EL1 or EL3 is the highest implemented Exception level and this register is implemented...

bitField.name: RR
bitField.description: Reset Request. Setting this bit to 1 requests a Warm reset.

bitField.name: AA64
bitField.description: When the highest implemented Exception level can use AArch64, determines which Execution state the PE boots into after a Warm reset:

register.name: RVBAR
register.description: If EL3 is not implemented, contains the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED address that execution starts from after reset when executing in AArch32 state.

register.name: ICC_MCTLR
register.description: Controls aspects of the behavior of the GIC CPU interface and provides information about the features implemented.

bitField.name: nDS
bitField.description: Disable Security not supported. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: A3V
bitField.description: Affinity 3 Valid. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: SEIS
bitField.description: SEI Support. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: IDbits
bitField.description: Identifier bits. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: PRIbits
bitField.description: Priority bits. Read-only and writes are ignored. The number of priority bits implemented, minus one.

bitField.name: PMHE
bitField.description: Priority Mask Hint Enable.

bitField.name: RM
bitField.description: SBZ.

bitField.name: EOImode_EL1NS
bitField.description: EOI mode for interrupts handled at Non-secure EL1 and EL2.

bitField.name: EOImode_EL1S
bitField.description: EOI mode for interrupts handled at Secure EL1.

bitField.name: EOImode_EL3
bitField.description: EOI mode for interrupts handled at EL3.

bitField.name: CBPR_EL1NS
bitField.description: Common Binary Point Register, EL1 Non-secure.

bitField.name: CBPR_EL1S
bitField.description: Common Binary Point Register, EL1 Secure.

register.name: ICC_MSRE
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Monitor System Register Enable register
register.description: Controls whether the System register interface or the memory-mapped interface to the GIC CPU interface is used for EL3.

bitField.name: Enable
bitField.description: Enable. Enables lower Exception level access to ICC_SRE and ICC_HSRE.

bitField.name: DIB
bitField.description: Disable IRQ bypass.

bitField.name: DFB
bitField.description: Disable FIQ bypass.

bitField.name: SRE
bitField.description: System Register Enable.

register.name: MVBAR
register.description: When EL3 is implemented and can use AArch32, holds the vector base address for any exception that is taken to Monitor mode...

bitField.name: Reserved
bitField.description: Reserved, see Configurations.

register.name: NSACR
register.description: When EL3 is implemented and can use AArch32, defines the Non-secure access permissions to Trace, Advanced SIMD and floating-point functionality. Also includes IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED bits that can define Non-secure access permissions for IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED functionality.

bitField.name: NSTRCDIS
bitField.description: Disables Non-secure System register accesses to all implemented trace registers.

bitField.name: NSASEDIS
bitField.description: Disables Non-secure access to the Advanced SIMD functionality.

bitField.name: cp11
bitField.description: The value of this field is ignored. If this field is programmed with a different value to the cp10 field then this field is UNKNOWN on a direct read of the NSACR.

bitField.name: cp10
bitField.description: Enable Non-secure access to the Advanced SIMD and floating-point features.

register.name: SCR
register.description: When EL3 is implemented and can use AArch32, defines the configuration of the current Security state. It specifies...

bitField.name: TERR
bitField.description: Trap Error record accesses.

bitField.name: TWE
bitField.description: Traps WFE instructions to Monitor mode.

bitField.name: TWI
bitField.description: Traps WFI instructions to Monitor mode.

bitField.name: SIF
bitField.description: Secure instruction fetch. When the PE is in Secure state, this bit disables instruction fetch from Non-secure memory.

bitField.name: HCE
bitField.description: Hypervisor Call instruction enable. Enables EL2 and Non-secure EL1 execution of HVC instructions.

bitField.name: SCD
bitField.description: Secure Monitor Call disable. Disables SMC instructions.

bitField.name: nET
bitField.description: Not Early Termination. This bit disables early termination.

bitField.name: AW
bitField.description: When the value of SCR.EA is 1 and the value of HCR.AMO is 0, this bit controls whether CPSR.

bitField.name: FW
bitField.description: When the value of SCR.FIQ is 1 and the value of HCR.FMO is 0, this bit controls whether CPSR.

bitField.name: EA
bitField.description: External Abort handler. This bit controls which mode takes external aborts.

bitField.name: FIQ
bitField.description: FIQ handler. This bit controls which mode takes FIQ exceptions.

bitField.name: IRQ
bitField.description: IRQ handler. This bit controls which mode takes IRQ exceptions.

bitField.name: NS
bitField.description: Non-secure bit.

register.name: SDCR
register.description: When EL3 is implemented and can use AArch32, controls debug and performance monitors functionality in Secure state.

bitField.name: EPMAD
bitField.description: External debug interface Performance Monitors registers disable.

bitField.name: EDAD
bitField.description: External debug interface breakpoint and watchpoint register access disable.

bitField.name: SPME
bitField.description: Secure Performance Monitors enable.

bitField.name: SPD
bitField.description: AArch32 Secure privileged debug. Enables or disables debug exceptions from Secure state, other than Breakpoint Instruction exceptions.

register.name: SDER
register.description: Controls invasive and non-invasive debug in the Secure EL0 mode.

bitField.name: SUNIDEN
bitField.description: Secure User Non-Invasive Debug Enable:

bitField.name: SUIDEN
bitField.description: Secure User Invasive Debug Enable:

register.name: ELR_hyp
register.description: When taking an exception to Hyp mode, holds the address to return to.

register.name: FPSCR
register.description: Provides floating-point system status information and control.

bitField.name: N
bitField.description: Negative condition flag. This is updated by floating-point comparison operations.

bitField.name: Z
bitField.description: Zero condition flag. This is updated by floating-point comparison operations.

bitField.name: C
bitField.description: Carry condition flag. This is updated by floating-point comparison operations.

bitField.name: V
bitField.description: Overflow condition flag. This is updated by floating-point comparison operations.

bitField.name: QC
bitField.description: Cumulative saturation bit, Advanced SIMD only. This bit is set to 1 to indicate that an Advanced SIMD integer operation has saturated since 0 was last written to this bit.

bitField.name: AHP
bitField.description: Alternative half-precision control bit:

bitField.name: DN
bitField.description: Default NaN mode control bit:

bitField.name: FZ
bitField.description: Flush-to-zero mode control bit:

bitField.name: RMode
bitField.description: Rounding Mode control field.

bitField.name: Stride
bitField.description: It is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED whether this field is RW or RAZ.

bitField.name: Len
bitField.description: It is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED whether this field is RW or RAZ.

bitField.name: IDE
bitField.description: Input Denormal floating-point exception trap enable.

bitField.name: IXE
bitField.description: Inexact floating-point exception trap enable.

bitField.name: UFE
bitField.description: Underflow floating-point exception trap enable.

bitField.name: OFE
bitField.description: Overflow floating-point exception trap enable.

bitField.name: DZE
bitField.description: Divide by Zero floating-point exception trap enable.

bitField.name: IOE
bitField.description: Invalid Operation floating-point exception trap enable.

bitField.name: IDC
bitField.description: Input Denormal cumulative floating-point exception bit. This bit is set to 1 to indicate that the Input Denormal floating-point exception has occurred since 0 was last written to this bit.

bitField.name: IXC
bitField.description: Inexact cumulative floating-point exception bit. This bit is set to 1 to indicate that the Inexact floating-point exception has occurred since 0 was last written to this bit.

bitField.name: UFC
bitField.description: Underflow cumulative floating-point exception bit. This bit is set to 1 to indicate that the Underflow floating-point exception has occurred since 0 was last written to this bit.

bitField.name: OFC
bitField.description: Overflow cumulative floating-point exception bit. This bit is set to 1 to indicate that the Overflow floating-point exception has occurred since 0 was last written to this bit.

bitField.name: DZC
bitField.description: Divide by Zero cumulative floating-point exception bit. This bit is set to 1 to indicate that the Divide by Zero floating-point exception has occurred since 0 was last written to this bit.

bitField.name: IOC
bitField.description: Invalid Operation cumulative floating-point exception bit. This bit is set to 1 to indicate that the Invalid Operation floating-point exception has occurred since 0 was last written to this bit.

register.name: SPSR_abt
register.description: Holds the saved process state when an exception is taken to Abort mode.

bitField.name: N
bitField.description: Set to the value of CPSR.N on taking an exception to Abort mode, and copied to CPSR.N on executing an exception return operation in Abort mode.

bitField.name: Z
bitField.description: Set to the value of CPSR.Z on taking an exception to Abort mode, and copied to CPSR.Z on executing an exception return operation in Abort mode.

bitField.name: C
bitField.description: Set to the value of CPSR.C on taking an exception to Abort mode, and copied to CPSR.C on executing an exception return operation in Abort mode.

bitField.name: V
bitField.description: Set to the value of CPSR.V on taking an exception to Abort mode, and copied to CPSR.V on executing an exception return operation in Abort mode.

bitField.name: Q
bitField.description: Set to the value of CPSR.Q on taking an exception to Abort mode, and copied to CPSR.Q on executing an exception return operation in Abort mode.

bitField.name: IT_1_0
bitField.description: IT block state bits for the T32 IT (If-Then) instruction. See IT[7:2] for explanation of this field.

bitField.name: J
bitField.description: RES0.

bitField.name: IL
bitField.description: Illegal Execution state bit. Shows the value of PSTATE.IL immediately before the exception was taken.

bitField.name: GE
bitField.description: Greater than or Equal flags, for parallel addition and subtraction.

bitField.name: IT_7_2
bitField.description: IT block state bits for the T32 IT (If-Then) instruction. This field must be interpreted in two parts.

bitField.name: E
bitField.description: Endianness state bit.

bitField.name: A
bitField.description: SError interrupt mask bit.

bitField.name: I
bitField.description: IRQ mask bit.

bitField.name: F
bitField.description: FIQ mask bit.

bitField.name: T
bitField.description: T32 Instruction set state bit. Determines the AArch32 instruction set state that the exception was taken from.

bitField.name: M_4
bitField.description: Execution state that the exception was taken from.

bitField.name: M_3_0
bitField.description: AArch32 mode that an exception was taken from.

bitField.description: IT block state bits for the T32 IT (If-Then) instruction. See IT[7:2] for explanation of this field.

bitField.name: J
bitField.description: RES0.

bitField.name: IL
bitField.description: Illegal Execution state bit. Shows the value of PSTATE.IL immediately before the exception was taken.

bitField.name: GE
bitField.description: Greater than or Equal flags, for parallel addition and subtraction.

bitField.name: IT_7_2
bitField.description: IT block state bits for the T32 IT (If-Then) instruction. This field must be interpreted in two parts.

bitField.name: E
bitField.description: Endianness state bit.

bitField.name: A
bitField.description: SError interrupt mask bit.

bitField.name: I
bitField.description: IRQ mask bit.

bitField.name: F
bitField.description: FIQ mask bit.

bitField.name: T
bitField.description: T32 Instruction set state bit. Determines the AArch32 instruction set state that the exception was taken from.

bitField.name: M_4
bitField.description: Execution state that the exception was taken from.

bitField.name: M_3_0
bitField.description: AArch32 mode that an exception was taken from.

bitField.name: C
bitField.description: Set to the value of CPSR.C on taking an exception to IRQ mode, and copied to CPSR.C on executing an exception return operation in IRQ mode.

bitField.name: V

register.name: DTLBIALL
register.description: Invalidate all cached copies of translation table entries from data TLBs that are from any level of the translation table walk. The entries that are invalidated are as follows...

register.name: DTLBIASID
register.gui_name: Data TLB Invalidate by ASID match
register.description: Invalidate all cached copies of translation table entries from data TLBs that meet the following requirements...

bitField.name: ASID
bitField.description: ASID value to match. Any TLB entries for non-global pages that match the ASID values will be affected by this operation.

register.name: DTLBIMVA
register.description: Invalidate all cached copies of translation table entries from data TLBs that meet the following requirements...

bitField.name: VA
bitField.description: Virtual address to match. Any TLB entries that match the ASID value and VA value will be affected by this operation.

bitField.name: ASID
bitField.description: ASID value to match. Any TLB entries that match the ASID value and VA value will be affected by this operation.

register.name: ITLBIALL
register.description: Invalidate all cached copies of translation table entries from instruction TLBs that are from any level of the translation table walk. The entries that are invalidated are as follows...

register.name: ITLBIASID

register.description: Invalidate all cached copies of translation table entries from instruction TLBs that meet the following requirements...

bitField.name: ASID
bitField.description: ASID value to match. Any TLB entries for non-global pages that match the ASID values will be affected by this operation.

register.name: ITLBIMVA
register.description: Invalidate all cached copies of translation table entries from instruction TLBs that meet the following requirements...

bitField.name: ASID
bitField.description: ASID value to match. Any TLB entries that match the ASID value and VA value will be affected by this operation.

register.name: TLBIALL
register.description: Invalidate all cached copies of translation table entries from TLBs that are from any level of the translation table walk. The entries that are invalidated are as follows...

register.name: TLBIALLH
register.description: If EL2 is implemented, invalidate all cached copies of translation table entries from TLBs that are from any level of the translation table walk that would be required for the Non-secure EL2 translation regime...

register.name: TLBIALLHIS
register.gui_name: TLB Invalidate All, Hyp mode, Inner Shareable
register.description: If EL2 is implemented, invalidate all cached copies of translation table entries from TLBs that are from any level of the translation table walk that would be required for the Non-secure EL2 translation regime...

register.name: TLBIALLIS
register.description: Invalidate all cached copies of translation table entries from TLBs that are from any level of the translation table walk. The entries that are invalidated are as follows...

register.name: TLBIALLNSNH
register.description: If EL2 is implemented, invalidate all cached copies of translation table entries from TLBs that are from any level of the translation table walk that would be required for stage 1 or stage 2 of the Non-secure PL1&0 translation regime, regardless of the associated VMID...

register.name: TLBIALLNSNHIS
register.gui_name: TLB Invalidate All, Non-Secure Non-Hyp, Inner Shareable
register.description: If EL2 is implemented, invalidate all cached copies of translation table entries from TLBs that are from any level of the translation table walk that would be required for stage 1 or stage 2 of the Non-secure PL1&0 translation regime, regardless of the associated VMID...

register.name: TLBIASID
register.description: Invalidate all cached copies of translation table entries from TLBs that meet the following requirements...

bitField.name: ASID

register.name: TLBIASIDIS
register.gui_name: TLB Invalidate by ASID match, Inner Shareable
register.description: Invalidate all cached copies of translation table entries from TLBs that meet the following requirements...

bitField.name: ASID
bitField.description: ASID value to match. Any TLB entries for non-global pages that match the ASID values will be affected by this operation.

register.name: TLBIIPAS2
