register.name: HTPIDR
register.description: Provides a location where software running in Hyp mode can store thread identifying information that is not visible to Non-secure software executing at EL0 or EL1, for hypervisor management purposes...

register.name: TPIDRPRW
register.description: Provides a location where software executing at EL1 or higher can store thread identifying information that is not visible to software executing at EL0, for OS management purposes...

register.name: S_TPIDRPRW
register.description: Provides a location where software executing at EL1 or higher can store thread identifying information that is not visible to software executing at EL0, for OS management purposes...

register.name: N_TPIDRPRW
register.description: Provides a location where software executing at EL1 or higher can store thread identifying information that is not visible to software executing at EL0, for OS management purposes...

register.name: TPIDRURO
register.gui_name: PL0 Read-Only Software Thread ID Register
register.description: Provides a location where software executing at EL1 or higher can store thread identifying information that is visible to software executing at EL0, for OS management purposes...

register.name: S_TPIDRURO
register.gui_name: PL0 Read-Only Software Thread ID Register
register.description: Provides a location where software executing at EL1 or higher can store thread identifying information that is visible to software executing at EL0, for OS management purposes...

register.name: N_TPIDRURO
register.gui_name: PL0 Read-Only Software Thread ID Register
register.description: Provides a location where software executing at EL1 or higher can store thread identifying information that is visible to software executing at EL0, for OS management purposes...

register.description: Provides a location where software executing at EL0 can store thread identifying information, for OS management purposes...

register.description: Provides a location where software executing at EL0 can store thread identifying information, for OS management purposes...

register.name: CNTFRQ
register.description: This register is provided so that software can discover the frequency of the system counter. It must be programmed with this value as part of system initialization. The value of the register is not interpreted by hardware.

register.name: CNTHCTL
register.description: Controls the generation of an event stream from the physical counter, and access from Non-secure EL1 modes to the physical counter and the Non-secure EL1 physical timer.

bitField.name: EVNTI
bitField.description: Selects which bit (0 to 15) of the counter register CNTPCT is the trigger for the event stream generated from that counter, when that stream is enabled.

bitField.name: EVNTDIR
bitField.description: Controls which transition of the counter register CNTPCT trigger bit, defined by EVNTI, generates an event when the event stream is enabled:

bitField.name: EVNTEN
bitField.description: Enables the generation of an event stream from the counter register CNTPCT:

bitField.name: PL1PCEN
bitField.description: Traps Non-secure EL0 and EL1 accesses to the physical timer registers to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: PL1PCTEN
bitField.description: Traps Non-secure EL0 and EL1 accesses to the physical counter register to Hyp mode.

register.name: CNTHP_CTL
register.gui_name: Counter-timer Hyp Physical Timer Control register
register.description: Control register for the Hyp mode physical timer.

bitField.name: ISTATUS
bitField.description: The status of the timer.

bitField.name: IMASK
bitField.description: Timer interrupt mask bit.

bitField.name: ENABLE
bitField.description: Enables the timer.

register.name: CNTHP_CVAL
register.description: Holds the compare value for the Hyp mode physical timer.

bitField.name: CompareValue
bitField.description: Holds the EL2 physical timer CompareValue.

register.name: CNTHP_TVAL
register.gui_name: Counter-timer Hyp Physical Timer TimerValue register
register.description: Holds the timer value for the Hyp mode physical timer.

bitField.name: TimerValue
bitField.description: The TimerValue view of the EL2 physical timer.

register.name: CNTKCTL
register.description: Controls the generation of an event stream from the virtual counter, and access from EL0 modes to the physical counter, virtual counter, EL1 physical timers, and the virtual timer.

bitField.name: PL0PTEN
bitField.description: Traps PL0 accesses to the physical timer registers to Undefined mode.

bitField.name: PL0VTEN
bitField.description: Traps PL0 accesses to the virtual timer registers to Undefined mode.

bitField.name: EVNTI
bitField.description: Selects which bit (0 to 15) of the counter register CNTVCT is the trigger for the event stream generated from that counter, when that stream is enabled.

bitField.name: EVNTDIR
bitField.description: Controls which transition of the counter register CNTVCT trigger bit, defined by EVNTI, generates an event when the event stream is enabled:

bitField.name: EVNTEN
bitField.description: Enables the generation of an event stream from the counter register CNTVCT:

bitField.name: PL0VCTEN
bitField.description: Traps PL0 accesses to the frequency register and virtual counter register to Undefined mode.

bitField.name: PL0PCTEN
bitField.description: Traps PL0 accesses to the frequency register and physical counter register to Undefined mode.

register.name: CNTPCT
register.description: Holds the 64-bit physical count value.

register.name: CNTP_CTL
register.description: Control register for the EL1 physical timer.

bitField.name: ISTATUS
bitField.description: The status of the timer.

bitField.name: IMASK
bitField.description: Timer interrupt mask bit.

bitField.name: ENABLE
bitField.description: Enables the timer.

register.name: S_CNTP_CTL
register.description: Control register for the EL1 physical timer.

bitField.name: ISTATUS
bitField.description: The status of the timer.

bitField.name: IMASK
bitField.description: Timer interrupt mask bit.

bitField.name: ENABLE
bitField.description: Enables the timer.

register.name: N_CNTP_CTL
register.description: Control register for the EL1 physical timer.

bitField.name: ISTATUS
bitField.description: The status of the timer.

bitField.name: IMASK
bitField.description: Timer interrupt mask bit.

bitField.name: ENABLE
bitField.description: Enables the timer.

register.name: CNTP_CVAL
register.description: Holds the compare value for the EL1 physical timer.

bitField.name: CompareValue
bitField.description: Holds the EL1 physical timer CompareValue.

register.name: S_CNTP_CVAL
register.description: Holds the compare value for the EL1 physical timer.

bitField.name: CompareValue
bitField.description: Holds the EL1 physical timer CompareValue.

register.name: N_CNTP_CVAL
register.description: Holds the compare value for the EL1 physical timer.

bitField.name: CompareValue
bitField.description: Holds the EL1 physical timer CompareValue.

register.name: CNTP_TVAL
register.description: Holds the timer value for the EL1 physical timer.

bitField.name: TimerValue
bitField.description: The TimerValue view of the EL1 physical timer.

register.name: S_CNTP_TVAL
register.description: Holds the timer value for the EL1 physical timer.

bitField.name: TimerValue
bitField.description: The TimerValue view of the EL1 physical timer.

register.name: N_CNTP_TVAL
register.description: Holds the timer value for the EL1 physical timer.

bitField.name: TimerValue
bitField.description: The TimerValue view of the EL1 physical timer.

register.name: CNTVCT
register.description: Holds the 64-bit virtual count value. The virtual count value is equal to the physical count value visible in CNTPCT minus the virtual offset visible in CNTVOFF.

register.name: CNTVOFF
register.description: Holds the 64-bit virtual offset. This is the offset between the physical count value visible in CNTPCT and the virtual count value visible in CNTVCT.

register.name: CNTV_CTL
register.description: Control register for the virtual timer.

bitField.name: ISTATUS
bitField.description: The status of the timer.

bitField.name: IMASK
bitField.description: Timer interrupt mask bit.

bitField.name: ENABLE
bitField.description: Enables the timer.

register.name: CNTV_CVAL
register.description: Holds the compare value for the virtual timer.

bitField.name: CompareValue
bitField.description: Holds the EL1 virtual timer CompareValue.

register.name: CNTV_TVAL
register.description: Holds the timer value for the virtual timer.

bitField.name: TimerValue
bitField.description: The TimerValue view of the virtual timer.

register.name: ATS1HR
register.gui_name: Address Translate Stage 1 Hyp mode Read
register.description: Performs stage 1 address translation as defined for PL2 and the Non-secure state, with permissions as if reading from the given virtual address.

register.name: ATS1HW
register.gui_name: Address Translate Stage 1 Hyp mode Write
register.description: Performs stage 1 address translation as defined for PL2 and the Non-secure state, with permissions as if writing to the given virtual address.

register.name: CNTHCTL
register.description: Controls the generation of an event stream from the physical counter, and access from Non-secure EL1 modes to the physical counter and the Non-secure EL1 physical timer.

bitField.name: EVNTI
bitField.description: Selects which bit (0 to 15) of the counter register CNTPCT is the trigger for the event stream generated from that counter, when that stream is enabled.

bitField.name: EVNTDIR
bitField.description: Controls which transition of the counter register CNTPCT trigger bit, defined by EVNTI, generates an event when the event stream is enabled:

bitField.name: EVNTEN
bitField.description: Enables the generation of an event stream from the counter register CNTPCT:

bitField.name: PL1PCEN
bitField.description: Traps Non-secure EL0 and EL1 accesses to the physical timer registers to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: PL1PCTEN
bitField.description: Traps Non-secure EL0 and EL1 accesses to the physical counter register to Hyp mode.

register.name: CNTHP_CVAL
register.description: Holds the compare value for the Hyp mode physical timer.

bitField.name: CompareValue
bitField.description: Holds the EL2 physical timer CompareValue.

register.name: CNTHP_TVAL
register.gui_name: Counter-timer Hyp Physical Timer TimerValue register
register.description: Holds the timer value for the Hyp mode physical timer.

bitField.name: TimerValue
bitField.description: The TimerValue view of the EL2 physical timer.

register.name: CNTVOFF
register.description: Holds the 64-bit virtual offset. This is the offset between the physical count value visible in CNTPCT and the virtual count value visible in CNTVCT.

register.name: HACR
register.description: Controls trapping to Hyp mode of IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED aspects of Non-secure EL1 or EL0 operation.

register.name: HACTLR
register.description: Controls IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED features of Hyp mode operation.

register.name: HACTLR2
register.description: Provides additional space to the HACTLR register to hold IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED trap functionality.

register.name: HADFSR
register.gui_name: Hyp Auxiliary Data Fault Status Register
register.description: Provides additional IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED syndrome information for Data Abort exceptions taken to Hyp mode.

register.name: HAIFSR
register.gui_name: Hyp Auxiliary Instruction Fault Status Register
register.description: Provides additional IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED syndrome information for Prefetch Abort exceptions taken to Hyp mode.

register.name: HAMAIR0
register.gui_name: Hyp Auxiliary Memory Attribute Indirection Register 0
register.description: Provides IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED memory attributes for the memory attribute encodings defined by HMAIR0. These IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED attributes can only provide additional qualifiers for the memory attribute encodings, and cannot change the memory attributes defined in HMAIR0.

register.name: HAMAIR1
register.gui_name: Hyp Auxiliary Memory Attribute Indirection Register 1
register.description: Provides IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED memory attributes for the memory attribute encodings defined by HMAIR1. These IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED attributes can only provide additional qualifiers for the memory attribute encodings, and cannot change the memory attributes defined in HMAIR1.

register.name: HCPTR
register.description: Controls...

bitField.name: TCPAC
bitField.description: Traps Non-secure EL1 accesses to the CPACR to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TTA
bitField.description: Traps Non-secure System register accesses to all implemented trace registers to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TASE
bitField.description: Traps Non-secure execution of Advanced SIMD instructions to Hyp mode when the value of HCPTR.TCP10 is 0.

bitField.name: TCP11
bitField.description: The value of this field is ignored. If this field is programmed with a different value to the TCP10 bit then this field is UNKNOWN on a direct read of the HCPTR.

bitField.name: TCP10
bitField.description: Trap Non-secure accesses to Advanced SIMD and floating-point functionality to Hyp mode:

register.name: HCR
register.description: Provides configuration controls for virtualization, including defining whether various Non-secure operations are trapped to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TRVM
bitField.description: Trap Reads of Virtual Memory controls. Traps Non-secure EL1 reads of the virtual memory control registers to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: HCD
bitField.description: HVC instruction disable. Disables Non-secure state execution of HVC instructions.

bitField.name: TGE
bitField.description: Trap General Exceptions, from Non-secure EL0.

bitField.name: TVM
bitField.description: Trap Virtual Memory controls. Traps Non-secure EL1 writes to the virtual memory control registers to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TTLB
bitField.description: Trap TLB maintenance instructions. Traps Non-secure EL1 execution of a TLBI instruction to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TPU
bitField.description: Trap cache maintenance instructions that operate to the Point of Unification. Traps Non-secure EL1 execution of those cache maintenance instructions to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TPC
bitField.description: Trap data or unified cache maintenance instructions that operate to the Point of Coherency. Traps Non-secure EL1 execution of those cache maintenance instructions to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TSW
bitField.description: Trap data or unified cache maintenance instructions that operate by Set/Way. Traps Non-secure EL1 execution of those cache maintenance instructions by set/way to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TAC
bitField.description: Trap Auxiliary Control Registers. Traps Non-secure EL1 accesses to the Auxiliary Control Registers to Hyp mode, from both Execution states.

bitField.name: TIDCP
bitField.description: Trap IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED functionality. Traps Non-secure EL1 accesses to the encodings for IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED System Registers to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TSC
bitField.description: Trap SMC instructions. Traps Non-secure EL1 execution of SMC instructions to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TID3
bitField.description: Trap ID group 3.

bitField.name: TID2
bitField.description: Trap ID group 2.

bitField.name: TID1
bitField.description: Trap ID group 1.

bitField.name: TID0
bitField.description: Trap ID group 0.

bitField.name: TWE
bitField.description: Traps Non-secure EL0 and EL1 execution of WFE instructions to Hyp mode:

bitField.name: TWI
bitField.description: Traps Non-secure EL0 and EL1 execution of WFI instructions to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: DC
bitField.description: Default Cacheability.

bitField.name: BSU
bitField.description: Barrier Shareability upgrade.

bitField.name: FB
bitField.description: Force broadcast.

bitField.name: VA
bitField.description: Virtual SError interrupt exception.

bitField.name: VI
bitField.description: Virtual IRQ exception.

bitField.name: VF
bitField.description: Virtual FIQ exception.

bitField.name: AMO
bitField.description: SError interrupt Mask Override. When this bit is set to 1, it overrides the effect of CPSR.A, and enables virtual exception signaling by the VA bit.

bitField.name: IMO
bitField.description: IRQ Mask Override. When this bit is set to 1, it overrides the effect of CPSR.I, and enables virtual exception signaling by the VI bit.

bitField.name: FMO
bitField.description: FIQ Mask Override. When this bit is set to 1, it overrides the effect of CPSR.F, and enables virtual exception signaling by the VF bit.

bitField.name: PTW
bitField.description: Protected Table Walk. In the Non-secure PL1&0 translation regime, a translation table access made as part of a stage 1 translation table walk is subject to a stage 2 translation. The combining of the memory type attributes from the two stages of translation means the access might be made to a type of Device memory.

bitField.name: SWIO
bitField.description: Set/Way Invalidation Override. Causes Non-secure EL1 execution of the data cache invalidate by set/way instructions to perform a data cache clean and invalidate by set/way.

bitField.name: VM
bitField.description: Virtualization enable. Enables stage 2 address translation for the Non-secure EL1&0 translation regime.

register.name: HCR2
register.description: Provides additional configuration controls for virtualization.

bitField.name: MIOCNCE
bitField.description: Mismatched Inner/Outer Cacheable Non-Coherency Enable, for the Non-secure PL1&0 translation regime.

bitField.name: TEA
bitField.description: Route synchronous External Abort exceptions to EL2.

bitField.name: TERR
bitField.description: Trap Error record accesses.

bitField.name: ID
bitField.description: Stage 2 Instruction access cacheability disable. For the Non-secure PL1&0 translation regime, when HCR.VM==1, this control forces all stage 2 translations for instruction accesses to Normal memory to be Non-cacheable.

bitField.name: CD
bitField.description: Stage 2 Data access cacheability disable. When HCR.VM==1, this forces all stage 2 translations for data accesses and translation table walks to Normal memory to be Non-cacheable for the Non-secure PL1&0 translation regime.

register.name: HDCR
register.description: Controls the trapping to Hyp mode of Non-secure accesses, at EL1 or lower, to functions provided by the debug and trace architectures and the Performance Monitors Extension.

bitField.name: TDRA
bitField.description: Trap Debug ROM Address register access. Traps Non-secure EL0 and EL1 System register accesses to the Debug ROM registers to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TDOSA
bitField.description: Trap debug OS-related register access. Traps Non-secure EL1 System register accesses to the powerdown debug registers to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TDA
bitField.description: Trap debug access.

bitField.name: TDE
bitField.description: Trap Debug exceptions.

bitField.name: HPME
bitField.description: Hypervisor Performance Monitors Enable.

bitField.name: TPM
bitField.description: Trap Performance Monitors accesses. Traps Non-secure EL0 and EL1 accesses to all Performance Monitors registers to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TPMCR
bitField.description: Trap PMCR accesses. Traps Non-secure EL0 and EL1 accesses to the PMCR to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: HPMN
bitField.description: Defines the number of Performance Monitors counters that are accessible from Non-secure EL1 modes, and from Non-secure EL0 modes if unprivileged access is enabled.

register.name: HDFAR
register.description: Holds the virtual address of the faulting address that caused a synchronous Data Abort exception that is taken to Hyp mode.

register.name: HIFAR
register.description: Holds the virtual address of the faulting address that caused a synchronous Prefetch Abort exception that is taken to Hyp mode.

register.name: HMAIR0
register.description: Along with HMAIR1, provides the memory attribute encodings corresponding to the possible AttrIndx values in a Long-descriptor format translation table entry for stage 1 translations for memory accesses from Hyp mode...

bitField.name: Attr3
bitField.description: The memory attribute encoding for an AttrIndx[2:0] entry in a Long descriptor format translation table entry, where:

bitField.name: Attr2
bitField.description: The memory attribute encoding for an AttrIndx[2:0] entry in a Long descriptor format translation table entry, where:

bitField.name: Attr1
bitField.description: The memory attribute encoding for an AttrIndx[2:0] entry in a Long descriptor format translation table entry, where:

bitField.name: Attr0
bitField.description: The memory attribute encoding for an AttrIndx[2:0] entry in a Long descriptor format translation table entry, where:

register.name: HMAIR1
register.description: Along with HMAIR0, provides the memory attribute encodings corresponding to the possible AttrIndx values in a Long-descriptor format translation table entry for stage 1 translations for memory accesses from Hyp mode...

bitField.name: Attr7
bitField.description: The memory attribute encoding for an AttrIndx[2:0] entry in a Long descriptor format translation table entry, where:

bitField.name: Attr6
bitField.description: The memory attribute encoding for an AttrIndx[2:0] entry in a Long descriptor format translation table entry, where:

bitField.name: Attr5
bitField.description: The memory attribute encoding for an AttrIndx[2:0] entry in a Long descriptor format translation table entry, where:

bitField.name: Attr4
bitField.description: The memory attribute encoding for an AttrIndx[2:0] entry in a Long descriptor format translation table entry, where:

register.name: HPFAR
register.description: Holds the faulting IPA for some aborts on a stage 2 translation taken to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: FIPA_39_12
bitField.description: Bits [39:12] of the faulting intermediate physical address.

register.name: HRMR
register.description: If EL2 is the highest implemented Exception level and this register is implemented...

bitField.name: RR
bitField.description: Reset Request. Setting this bit to 1 requests a Warm reset.

bitField.name: AA64
bitField.description: When EL2 can use AArch64, determines which Execution state the PE boots into after a Warm reset:

register.name: HSCTLR
register.description: Provides top level control of the system operation in Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TE
bitField.description: T32 Exception Enable.

bitField.name: EE
bitField.description: The value of the PSTATE.E bit on entry to Hyp mode, the endianness of stage 1 translation table walks in the EL2 translation regime, and the endianness of stage 2 translation table walks in the PL1&0 translation regime.

bitField.name: WXN
bitField.description: Write permission implies XN (Execute-never). For the EL2 translation regime, this bit can force all memory regions that are writable to be treated as XN.

bitField.name: I
bitField.description: Instruction access Cacheability control, for accesses at EL2:

bitField.name: SED
bitField.description: SETEND instruction disable. Disables SETEND instructions at EL2.

bitField.name: ITD
bitField.description: IT Disable. Disables some uses of IT instructions at EL2.

bitField.name: CP15BEN
bitField.description: System instruction memory barrier enable.

bitField.name: C
bitField.description: Cacheability control, for data accesses at EL2:

bitField.name: A
bitField.description: Alignment check enable.

bitField.name: M
bitField.description: MMU enable for EL2 stage 1 address translation.

register.name: HSR
register.description: Holds syndrome information for an exception taken to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: EC
bitField.description: Exception Class. Indicates the reason for the exception that this register holds information about.

bitField.name: IL
bitField.description: Instruction length bit. Indicates the size of the instruction that has been trapped to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: CV
bitField.description: Condition code valid.

bitField.name: COND
bitField.description: The condition code for the trapped instruction.

bitField.name: TI
bitField.description: Trapped instruction.

bitField.name: CV
bitField.description: Condition code valid.

bitField.name: COND
bitField.description: The condition code for the trapped instruction.

bitField.name: Opc2
bitField.description: The Opc2 value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Opc1
bitField.description: The Opc1 value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: CRn
bitField.description: The CRn value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Rt
bitField.description: The Rt value from the issued instruction, the general-purpose register used for the transfer.

bitField.name: CRm
bitField.description: The CRm value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Direction
bitField.description: Indicates the direction of the trapped instruction.

bitField.name: CV
bitField.description: Condition code valid.

bitField.name: COND
bitField.description: The condition code for the trapped instruction.

bitField.name: Opc1
bitField.description: The Opc1 value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Rt2
bitField.description: The Rt2 value from the issued instruction, the second general-purpose register used for the transfer.

bitField.name: Rt
bitField.description: The Rt value from the issued instruction, the first general-purpose register used for the transfer.

bitField.name: CRm
bitField.description: The CRm value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Direction
bitField.description: Indicates the direction of the trapped instruction.

bitField.name: CV
bitField.description: Condition code valid.

bitField.name: COND
bitField.description: The condition code for the trapped instruction.

bitField.name: imm8
bitField.description: The immediate value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Rn
bitField.description: The Rn value from the issued instruction. Valid only when AM[2] is 0, indicating an immediate form of the LDC or STC instruction.

bitField.name: Offset
bitField.description: Indicates whether the offset is added or subtracted:

bitField.name: AM
bitField.description: Addressing mode.

bitField.name: Direction
bitField.description: Indicates the direction of the trapped instruction.

bitField.name: CV
bitField.description: Condition code valid.

bitField.name: COND
bitField.description: The condition code for the trapped instruction.

bitField.name: TA
bitField.description: Indicates trapped use of Advanced SIMD functionality.

bitField.name: coproc
bitField.description: When the TA field returns the value 1, this field returns the value 1010, otherwise this field is RES0.

bitField.name: imm16
bitField.description: The value of the immediate field from the HVC or SVC instruction.

bitField.name: CV
bitField.description: Condition code valid.

bitField.name: COND
bitField.description: The condition code for the trapped instruction.

bitField.name: CCKNOWNPASS
bitField.description: Indicates whether the instruction might have failed its condition code check.

bitField.name: FnV
bitField.description: FAR not Valid, for a Synchronous external abort other than a Synchronous external abort on a translation table walk.

bitField.name: EA
bitField.description: External abort type. This bit can provide an IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED classification of External aborts.

bitField.name: S1PTW
bitField.description: For a stage 2 fault, indicates whether the fault was a stage 2 fault on an access made for a stage 1 translation table walk:

bitField.name: IFSC
bitField.description: Instruction Fault Status Code.

bitField.name: ISV
bitField.description: Instruction syndrome valid. Indicates whether the syndrome information in ISS[23:14] is valid.

bitField.name: SAS
bitField.description: Syndrome Access Size. When ISV is 1, indicates the size of the access attempted by the faulting operation.

bitField.name: SSE
bitField.description: Syndrome Sign Extend. When ISV is 1, for a byte, halfword, or word load operation, indicates whether the data item must be sign extended.

bitField.name: SRT
bitField.description: Syndrome Register transfer. When ISV is 1, the register number of the Rt operand of the faulting instruction.

bitField.name: AR
bitField.description: Acquire/Release.

bitField.name: AET
bitField.description: Asynchronous Error Type.

bitField.name: FnV
bitField.description: FAR not Valid, for a Synchronous external abort other than a Synchronous external abort on a translation table walk.

bitField.name: EA
bitField.description: External abort type. This bit can provide an IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED classification of External aborts.

bitField.name: CM
bitField.description: Cache maintenance. For a synchronous fault, identifies fault that comes from a cache maintenance or address translation instruction.

bitField.name: S1PTW
bitField.description: For a stage 2 fault, indicates whether the fault was a stage 2 fault on an access made for a stage 1 translation table walk:

bitField.name: WnR
bitField.description: Write not Read. Indicates whether a synchronous abort was caused by a write instruction or a read instruction.

bitField.name: DFSC
bitField.description: Data Fault Status Code.

register.name: HSTR
register.description: Controls trapping to Hyp mode of Non-secure accesses, at EL1 or lower, to the System register in the coproc == 1111 encoding space, by the CRn value used to access the register using MCR or MRC instruction. When the register is accessible using an MCRR or MRRC instruction, this is the CRm value used to access the register.

bitField.description: Fields T14 and T4 are RES0.

bitField.description: Fields T14 and T4 are RES0.

register.name: HTCR
register.description: The control register for stage 1 of the EL2 translation regime.

bitField.name: SH0
bitField.description: Shareability attribute for memory associated with translation table walks using HTTBR.

bitField.name: ORGN0
bitField.description: Outer cacheability attribute for memory associated with translation table walks using HTTBR.

bitField.name: IRGN0
bitField.description: Inner cacheability attribute for memory associated with translation table walks using HTTBR.

bitField.name: T0SZ
bitField.description: The size offset of the memory region addressed by HTTBR. The region size is 2^(32-T0SZ) bytes.

register.name: HTPIDR
register.description: Provides a location where software running in Hyp mode can store thread identifying information that is not visible to Non-secure software executing at EL0 or EL1, for hypervisor management purposes...

register.name: HTTBR
register.description: Holds the base address of the translation table for the initial lookup for stage 1 of an address translation in the EL2 translation regime, and other information for this translation regime.

bitField.name: BADDR
bitField.description: Translation table base address, bits[47:x], Bits [x-1:0] are RES0, with the additional requirement that if bits[x-1:3] are not all zero, this is a misaligned translation table base address, with effects that are CONSTRAINED UNPREDICTABLE, and must be one of the following:

register.name: HVBAR
register.description: Holds the vector base address for any exception that is taken to Hyp mode.

register.name: ICC_HSRE
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Hyp System Register Enable register
register.description: Controls whether the System register interface or the memory-mapped interface to the GIC CPU interface is used for EL2.

bitField.name: DIB
bitField.description: Disable IRQ bypass.

bitField.name: DFB
bitField.description: Disable FIQ bypass.

bitField.name: SRE
bitField.description: System Register Enable.

register.name: ICH_HCR
register.description: Controls the environment for VMs.

bitField.name: EOIcount
bitField.description: This field is incremented whenever a successful write to a virtual EOIR or DIR register would have resulted in a virtual interrupt deactivation.

bitField.name: TDIR
bitField.description: Trap Non-secure EL1 writes to ICC_DIR and ICV_DIR.

bitField.name: TSEI
bitField.description: Trap all locally generated SEIs. This bit allows the hypervisor to intercept locally generated SEIs that would otherwise be taken at Non-secure EL1.

bitField.name: TALL1
bitField.description: Trap all Non-secure EL1 accesses to ICC_* and ICV_* System registers for Group 1 interrupts to EL2.

bitField.name: TALL0
bitField.description: Trap all Non-secure EL1 accesses to ICC_* and ICV_* System registers for Group 0 interrupts to EL2.

bitField.name: TC
bitField.description: Trap all Non-secure EL1 accesses to System registers that are common to Group 0 and Group 1 to EL2.

bitField.name: VGrp1DIE
bitField.description: VM Group 1 Disabled Interrupt Enable.

bitField.name: VGrp1EIE
bitField.description: VM Group 1 Enabled Interrupt Enable.

bitField.name: VGrp0DIE
bitField.description: VM Group 0 Disabled Interrupt Enable.

bitField.name: VGrp0EIE
bitField.description: VM Group 0 Enabled Interrupt Enable.

bitField.name: NPIE
bitField.description: No Pending Interrupt Enable.

bitField.name: LRENPIE
bitField.description: List Register Entry Not Present Interrupt Enable.

bitField.name: UIE
bitField.description: Underflow Interrupt Enable.

bitField.name: En
bitField.description: Enable.

bitField.name: HW
bitField.description: Indicates whether this virtual interrupt maps directly to a hardware interrupt, meaning that it corresponds to a physical interrupt. Deactivation of the virtual interrupt also causes the deactivation of the physical interrupt with the INTID that the pINTID field indicates.

bitField.name: Group
bitField.description: Indicates the group for this virtual interrupt.

bitField.name: Priority
bitField.description: The priority of this interrupt.

bitField.name: pINTID
bitField.description: Physical INTID, for hardware interrupts.

register.name: ICH_MISR
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Maintenance Interrupt State Register
register.description: Indicates which maintenance interrupts are asserted.

bitField.name: VGrp1D
bitField.description: vPE Group 1 Disabled.

bitField.name: VGrp1E
bitField.description: vPE Group 1 Enabled.

bitField.name: VGrp0D
bitField.description: vPE Group 0 Disabled.

bitField.name: VGrp0E
bitField.description: vPE Group 0 Enabled.

bitField.name: NP
bitField.description: No Pending.

bitField.name: LRENP
bitField.description: List Register Entry Not Present.

bitField.name: U
bitField.description: Underflow.

bitField.name: EOI
bitField.description: End Of Interrupt.

register.name: ICH_VMCR
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Virtual Machine Control Register
register.description: Enables the hypervisor to save and restore the virtual machine view of the GIC state.

bitField.name: VPMR
bitField.description: Virtual Priority Mask. The priority mask level for the virtual CPU interface. If the priority of a pending virtual interrupt is higher than the value indicated by this field, the interface signals the virtual interrupt to the PE.

bitField.name: VBPR0
bitField.description: Virtual Binary Point Register, Group 0. Defines the point at which the priority value fields split into two parts, the group priority field and the subpriority field. The group priority field determines Group 0 interrupt preemption, and also determines Group 1 interrupt preemption if ICH_VMCR.VCBPR == 1.

bitField.name: VBPR1
bitField.description: Virtual Binary Point Register, Group 1. Defines the point at which the priority value fields split into two parts, the group priority field and the subpriority field. The group priority field determines Group 1 interrupt preemption if ICH_VMCR.VCBPR == 0.

bitField.name: VEOIM
bitField.description: Virtual EOI mode.

bitField.name: VCBPR
bitField.description: Virtual Common Binary Point Register.

bitField.name: VFIQEn
bitField.description: Virtual FIQ enable.

bitField.name: VAckCtl
bitField.description: Virtual AckCtl.

bitField.name: VENG1
bitField.description: Virtual Group 1 interrupt enable.

bitField.name: VENG0
bitField.description: Virtual Group 0 interrupt enable.

register.name: ICH_VTR
register.description: Reports supported GIC virtualisartion features.

bitField.name: PRIbits
bitField.description: Priority bits. The number of virtual priority bits implemented, minus one.

bitField.name: PREbits
bitField.description: The number of virtual preemption bits implemented, minus one.

bitField.name: IDbits
bitField.description: The number of virtual interrupt identifier bits supported:

bitField.name: SEIS
bitField.description: SEI Support.

bitField.name: A3V
bitField.description: Affinity 3 Valid.

bitField.name: nV4
bitField.description: Direct injection of virtual interrupts not supported.

bitField.name: TDS
bitField.description: Separate trapping of Non-secure EL1 writes to ICV_DIR supported.

bitField.name: ListRegs
bitField.description: The number of implemented List registers, minus one. For example, a value of 0b01111 indicates that the maximum of 16 List registers are implemented.

register.name: TLBIALLH
register.description: If EL2 is implemented, invalidate all cached copies of translation table entries from TLBs that are from any level of the translation table walk that would be required for the Non-secure EL2 translation regime...

register.name: TLBIALLHIS
register.gui_name: TLB Invalidate All, Hyp mode, Inner Shareable
register.description: If EL2 is implemented, invalidate all cached copies of translation table entries from TLBs that are from any level of the translation table walk that would be required for the Non-secure EL2 translation regime...

register.name: TLBIIPAS2
register.gui_name: TLB Invalidate by Intermediate Physical Address, Stage 2
register.description: If EL2 is implemented, invalidate all cached copies of translation table entries from TLBs that meet the following requirements...

bitField.name: IPA_39_12
bitField.description: Bits[39:12] of the intermediate physical address to match.

register.name: TLBIIPAS2IS
register.gui_name: TLB Invalidate by Intermediate Physical Address, Stage 2, Inner Shareable
register.description: If EL2 is implemented, invalidate all cached copies of translation table entries from TLBs that meet the following requirements...

bitField.name: IPA_39_12
bitField.description: Bits[39:12] of the intermediate physical address to match.

register.name: TLBIIPAS2L
register.gui_name: TLB Invalidate by Intermediate Physical Address, Stage 2, Last level
register.description: If EL2 is implemented, invalidate all cached copies of translation table entries from TLBs that meet the following requirements...

bitField.name: IPA_39_12
bitField.description: Bits[39:12] of the intermediate physical address to match.

register.name: TLBIIPAS2LIS
register.gui_name: TLB Invalidate by Intermediate Physical Address, Stage 2, Last level, Inner Shareable
register.description: If EL2 is implemented, invalidate all cached copies of translation table entries from TLBs that meet the following requirements...

bitField.name: IPA_39_12
bitField.description: Bits[39:12] of the intermediate physical address to match.

register.name: TLBIMVAH
register.gui_name: TLB Invalidate by VA, Hyp mode
register.description: If EL2 is implemented, invalidate all cached copies of translation table entries from TLBs that are from any level of the translation table walk that would be required for the Non-secure EL2 translation regime and used to translate the specified address...

bitField.name: VA
bitField.description: Virtual address to match. Any TLB entries that match the ASID value and VA value will be affected by this operation.

register.name: TLBIMVAHIS
register.gui_name: TLB Invalidate by VA, Hyp mode, Inner Shareable
register.description: If EL2 is implemented, invalidate all cached copies of translation table entries from TLBs that are from any level of the translation table walk that would be required for the Non-secure EL2 translation regime and used to translate the specified address...

bitField.name: VA
bitField.description: Virtual address to match. Any TLB entries that match the ASID value and VA value will be affected by this operation.

register.name: TLBIMVALH
register.gui_name: TLB Invalidate by VA, Last level, Hyp mode
register.description: If EL2 is implemented, invalidate all cached copies of translation table entries from TLBs that are from the final level of the translation table walk that would be required for the Non-secure EL2 translation regime and used to translate the specified address...

bitField.name: VA
bitField.description: Virtual address to match. Any TLB entries that match the ASID value and VA value will be affected by this operation.

register.name: TLBIMVALHIS
register.gui_name: TLB Invalidate by VA, Last level, Hyp mode, Inner Shareable
register.description: If EL2 is implemented, invalidate all cached copies of translation table entries from TLBs that are from the final level of the translation table walk that would be required for the Non-secure EL2 translation regime and used to translate the specified address...

bitField.name: VA
bitField.description: Virtual address to match. Any TLB entries that match the ASID value and VA value will be affected by this operation.

register.name: VMPIDR
register.description: Holds the value of the Virtualization Multiprocessor ID. This is the value returned by Non-secure EL1 reads of MPIDR.

bitField.name: M
bitField.description: Indicates whether this implementation includes the functionality introduced by the ARMv7 Multiprocessing Extensions.

bitField.name: U
bitField.description: Indicates a Uniprocessor system, as distinct from PE 0 in a multiprocessor system.

bitField.name: MT
bitField.description: Indicates whether the lowest level of affinity consists of logical PEs that are implemented using a multithreading type approach.

bitField.name: Aff2
bitField.description: Affinity level 2. The least significant affinity level field, for this PE in the system.

bitField.name: Aff1
bitField.description: Affinity level 1. The intermediate affinity level field, for this PE in the system.

bitField.name: Aff0
bitField.description: Affinity level 0. The most significant affinity level field, for this PE in the system.

register.name: VPIDR
register.description: Holds the value of the Virtualization Processor ID. This is the value returned by Non-secure EL1 reads of MIDR.

bitField.name: Implementer
bitField.description: The Implementer code. This field must hold an implementer code that has been assigned by ARM.

bitField.name: Variant
bitField.description: An IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED variant number. Typically, this field is used to distinguish between different product variants, or major revisions of a product.

bitField.name: Architecture
bitField.description: The permitted values of this field are:

bitField.name: PartNum
bitField.description: An IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED primary part number for the device.

bitField.name: Revision
bitField.description: An IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED revision number for the device.

register.name: VTCR
register.description: The control register for stage 2 of the Non-secure PL1&0 translation regime.

bitField.name: SH0
bitField.description: Shareability attribute for memory associated with translation table walks using VTTBR.

bitField.name: ORGN0
bitField.description: Outer cacheability attribute for memory associated with translation table walks using VTTBR.

bitField.name: IRGN0
bitField.description: Inner cacheability attribute for memory associated with translation table walks using VTTBR.

bitField.name: SL0
bitField.description: Starting level for translation table walks using VTTBR.

bitField.name: S
bitField.description: Sign extension bit. This bit must be programmed to the value of T0SZ[3]. If it is not, then the behavior is CONSTRAINED UNPREDICTABLE and the stage 2 T0SZ value is treated as an UNKNOWN value, see .

bitField.name: T0SZ
bitField.description: The size offset of the memory region addressed by VTTBR. The region size is 2^(32-T0SZ) bytes.

register.name: VTTBR
register.description: Holds the base address of the translation table for the initial lookup for stage 2 of an address translation in the Non-secure PL1&0 translation regime, and other information for this translation regime.

bitField.name: VMID
bitField.description: The VMID for the translation table.

bitField.name: BADDR
bitField.description: Translation table base address, bits[47:x], Bits [x-1:0] are RES0, with the additional requirement that if bits[x-1:3] are not all zero, this is a misaligned translation table base address, with effects that are CONSTRAINED UNPREDICTABLE, and must be one of the following:

register.name: L2CTLR
register.description: L2 Control Register.

register.name: L2ECTLR
register.description: L2 Extended Control Register.

register.name: L2ACTLR
register.description: L2 Auxiliary Control Register.

register.name: CBAR
register.description: Configuration Base Address Register.

register.name: CPUACTLR
register.description: CPU Auxiliary Control Register.

register.name: CPUECTLR
register.description: CPU Extended Control Register.

register.name: L2MERRSR
register.description: L2 Memory Error Syndrome Register.
